El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano II, se conformó en fecha 03 de febrero del 2010, y actualmente han mejorado sus actividades gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido de la Fundación  Paraguaya por medio del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación  Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Domitila quien posee una tienda de venta de ropas, al cual se dedica hace ya bastantes años, por lo que es conocida en la zona y posee buena clientela formada.
Durante la temporada otoño-invierno le fue muy bien con la venta de ropas abrigadas, asi también desea que con la llegada de la nueva estación pueda seguir comercializando sus mercaderías.
Para solicita nuevamente el prestamo para la compra de prendas de vestir primavera - verano como remeras, vestidos, camisas, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The committee of women with the name San Cayetano II was formed on the date of the third of February, 2010. Currently, they have improved their work thanks to the financial support received from the Fundación Paraguaya through the program, Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). All of them perform fundraising work and mutually help each other to achieve their common objectives which they all have in the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is Domitila who owns a clothing shop, to which she has been dedicated for several years since it is well known in the area and has a good, established customer base. During the autumn/winter season, sales of warm clothing were good and she hopes to continue selling her merchandise with the arrival of the new season. She is requesting a loan to purchase spring/summer clothing such as shirts, dresses, blouses among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire spring/summer clothing at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua T. is married and takes care of eight dependants. She has been through junior high school. Efua sells rice, sugar, plantains, green leaves and cassava in Elmina. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers. Efua anticipates ploughing the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Huaytara Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Rosita de Huaytara inicia su ciclo 2, las socias son del Distrito de Huaytara.
La señora Solange es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 07 años, que estudian, Solange vende cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, su negocio es compartido con las tareas del hogar, en sus tiempos libres sale a ofrecer sus productos, Solange desde que esta en su Banco aprendió a ser responsable y los prestamos le ayudaron mucho para incrementar sus productos, con el préstamo que solicita comprara cosméticos en oferta que venderá a mayor precio.
Los sueños de Solange es que sus dos hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The members of the Santa Rosita de Huaytara communal bank are starting their second loan cycle. They are from the district of Huaytara. Solange is in a common-law marriage. She has two children, ages 14 and 7, who are still in school. She sells cosmetics from catalogs to her friends and family. She divides her time between her business and her housework. In her spare time, she goes out to sell her products. Since becoming a member of her communal bank, Solange has learned to be responsible. The loans have helped to increase her inventory. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy cosmetics on sale which she will sell at a profit. Solange dreams of her two daughters becoming professionals and of owning a cosmetics store for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Menana

texts.en: Menana G. prepares banku (a local dish made from corn dough) for sale and also sells maize in Elmina. Menana has been educated up to the junior high school level. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She helps her husband provide for the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to cook and to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to cook and to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: afi A. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'awatamé. son époux est un chauffeur. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce, son stock de marchandise a diminué. elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et commencer en même temps la vente de produits d'alimentation générale raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 50 pagnes de qualité Hi target et divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Afi A. is 38 years-old, married and the mother of four children. She and her family live in the Awatamé district. Her husband is a driver. She operates a business selling pagnes (a colorful West African fabric). She has five years experience in this business and her stock of merchandise is low. She wants to replenish her stock and, at the same time, start selling general food products. For this reason she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 50 Hi Target pagnes and a variety of general food products.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne fabric

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Mórrope un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en pequeñas areas rurales que distan mucho entre si. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral desde hace cinco años, el cría sus animales en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que visitan la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en la municipalidad de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para sostener la economia de su familia.

Actualmente desea adquirir mas aves y alimento balanceado para poder implementar su negocio de crianza y venta. Esto le permitira ampliar sus ventas y percbir mayores ganancias que utilizará en el progreso de su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Nestor es una persona responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido un préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nestor is a 32 year old father. He lives with his wife and their three children in the Mórrope district. This district is characterized as having the majority of its population concentrated in small rural areas that are distant from one another. It is located in the Lambayeque province and is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Nestor has been raising and selling poultry for five years. He raises his animals in an area in the back of his house. When they are big enough he sells them to his neighbors and the merchants that visit the area. Additionally, he works as a laborer for the municipality in his district. The money that he earns from these activities supports his family. Currently, he would like to acquire more birds and balanced feed in order to be able to increase his sales and earn a better wage that he will use to help his family get ahead. To achieve his goal he has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa. Nestor is a responsible person that always ensures the well-being and development of those close to him. He has had a previous loan with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown that he is punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Tambo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa de Tambo inicia su segundo ciclo, las socias son del Distrito de Ayavi.
La socia Erika es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 07 y 09 años que estudian, Erika y su esposos se dedican a la producción de lácteos (quesos), Erika dirige una asociación de productores lácteos, que producen diferentes productos como quesos, mantequilla, manjar y yogurt, Erika desea fortalecer mas su asociación, el tiempo que esta en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y con el préstamo que obtuvo mejoro su negocio, Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche e implementar sus equipos.
Los sueños de Erika es educar a a sus hijos, fortalecer su asociación y tener una tienda de venta en la ciudad de Ica.
texts.en:
The Santa de Tambo communal bank is beginning its second cycle. The members are from the district of Ayavi. Erika is married and has 2 children, ages 7 and 9, who are still in school. She and her husband produce dairy products (cheeses). She is director of a dairy producers association that produces various products such as cheese, butter, manjar (sweet caramel made from condensed milk, similar to dulce de leche), and yogurt. She wants to strengthen her association. During the time that she has been a member of her communal bank, she has learned to save. With the loan, she improved her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk and install her equipment. Erika dreams of educating her children, strengthening her association, and having a retail store in the city of Ica.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk and install her equipment.

loans.name: Richard Emilio

texts.es: Richar vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Las Lomas de ciudad de La Paz. Richard trabaja en la empresa maderera concepción como asalariado y está es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para pagar sus mensualidades de la universidad. El estudia contaduría pública.Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Richard lives with his parents in the Las Lomas neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Richard works as a salaried employee of the Concepción lumber company; this is his primary source of income. He will use this loan to cover his university tuition, which is paid on a monthly basis. He is studying Public Accounting. This is his first loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Pay monthly university tuition

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en: Zinabu A. buys fresh fish and fries it for sale in Elmina. Zinabu has no formal education. She is divorced and lives with her four children. She responsibly makes sure that the children are well taken care of. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enter into another kind of business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells small and large quantities of oranges in Elmina. She has received a senior high school education. She is married and lives with her five dependants. Her husband is a trader. Ekua has been selling oranges for five years. She is supportive of her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of oranges for distribution. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of oranges for distribution

loans.name: Ogom Yawa

texts.fr: D. est une jeune femme mariée , elle est mère d'un enfant et réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d'avédji qui est l'un des quartiers périphériques et dynamique de la ville de Lomé. en 2001 elle a commencé par vendre des tissus, elle fait son activité au marché local de totsi. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. en ce début d'année surtout, la demande de sa clientèle est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 5 balles de tissus de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
Ms. D. is a young married woman. She has one child and lives with her family in the Avédji district, a dynamic district on the periphery of the city of Lomé. In 2001 she started selling fabric. She sells at the local market of Totsi. Her customer base is very diverse. At the beginning of this new year, the customer demand is especially high, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to expand her stock and purchase five bolts of quality fabrics.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Chaulisma Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen D. Chaulisma son del Distrito D. Ayavi, inician su segundo ciclo.
La señora Sofia es casada y tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores y estudian en la universidad, Sofia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además tiene un restaurante en donD. da el servicio D. pensión a los profesores, actividad que realiza todos los días, también venD. quesos, desD. que inicio como socia en Finca Perú aumento su negocio gracias a los prestamos que le ayudaron a comprar mas insumos y productos. Sofia solicita un crédito para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite.
Las metas que tiene Sofía son que sus hijos sean profesionales y estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Virgen del Carmen D. Chaulisma” communal bank are from Ayavi district; they are starting their second cycle. Sofía is married and has 5 adult children who are in the university. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She also has a restaurant where she provides board to the professors daily. She also sells cheese. Since becoming a member of Finca Perú her business grew thanks to the loans that helped her buy more ingredients and products. Sofía is asking for funds to buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil. Her goals are that her children become professionals and to stabilize her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Juntas son D. la comunidad D. Pilpichaca.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocio como la venta D. ropa, animales y comida.
Como es el caso D. la señora Teresa que es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Teresa venD. ropa variada para varones y mujeres, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias D. su región, sus productos los compra en la ciudad D. Lima y Huancayo a donD. viaja mensualmente, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Teresa solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños D. Teresa son ahorrar lo suficiente para tener su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the Trabajando Juntas communal bank are from the community of Pilpichaca. The members are engaged in various businesses such as clothing sales, raising animals, and food services. Teresa is married and has 6 children. She sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing at the regional markets. With her children along to help her, she travels monthly to the cities of Lima y Huancayo to buy her merchandise. Teresa is requesting this loan to purchase sweaters, trousers, and coats. Teresa dreams of saving enough money to have her business at her home. .

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de chompas, pantalones y casacas. To purchase sweaters, trousers, and coats.

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
Fanny de 29 años, tiene una local donde vende productos naturales, vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Por la falta de oportunidades y aprender mas sobre la salud del cuerpo humano ella comenzó a vender productos naturales como “Herbalife” empresa que vende productos naturales a un bajo costo para micro empresarios.  Ella inicia en las mañanas a dar charlas a sus clientes y después le ofrece los productos, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas para su negocio y energizantes. En el futuro quiere tener su propio centro naturista para tener ingresos sostenibles.
texts.en:
Fanny is 29 years old and has a shop where she sells natural products. She lives in the urban area of “Orquídeas”. (It was named “the orchids” because a large number of these flowers were found there at the time of its discovery). Due to lack of other opportunities, she decided to learn more about the health of the human body and began selling products for “Herbal Life”, a company that sells natural products to micro-businesses at a low price. She begins by chatting with her customers and then offers them her products. She works from very early in the morning until nightfall. With the loan, she wants to buy display cases and “Herbal Life” energizers for her business. In the future, she wants to have her own naturalistic center so she will have sustainable income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display cases, "Herbal Life" energizers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa B. operates a small provisions shop in Elmina. She has no formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to fill her shop for sale. She hopes to plough her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to fill her shop for sale

loans.name: Thomas Messanvi

texts.fr: cet monsieur est âgé de 50 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants,l'activité qu'il  exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille est le commerce de articles de quincaillerie, il détient sa propre boutique qu'il appelle "ETS GAMATO". il s'approvisionne à Lomé. la demande de sa clientèle est élevée. il souhaiterai s'approvisionner pour répondre convenablement aux besoins de sa clientèle raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 80 boîtes de colle, 1800 barres de fer et 25  bidons de carbure.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is 50 years old, married, and a father of two children. The work he does which enables him to support his family involves commerce in hardware. He has his own shop called "ETS GAMATO". He gets his supplies in Lomé. The demand from his customers is high. He would like to stock up in order to respond suitably to their needs. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 80 cans of glue, 1,800 iron rods, and 25 containers of fuel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hardware items

loans.name: El Zapote 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo El zapote 3 esta integrado por 4 mujeres luchadoras y que tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Angela O. V. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de gallinas desde hace 12 años, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela.  Angela y su esposo trabajan 
duro para sacar adelante su familia, su esposo trabaja en una camaronera y sus tiempos libres los dedica para visitar a sus padres y hermanos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar gallinas.

Lizhet del Carmen O. es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, Lizhet es soltera y vive con sus papas.
lizhet ayuda economicamente a sus padres para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y salir a venderlas en su comunidad.
su tiempo libre lo dedica  para ir a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar harina de maiz, cal, leña, agua.

Blanca Luz O. una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia, Blanca  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes, junto con su esposo han sacado adelante su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.

Deysi Isabel V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia desde hace  6 años.
Deysi es madre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela.
todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atendrer a sus clientes  y despachar a sus hijos para la escuela.
sus tiempos libres los dedica para asistir a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The El Zapote Group is made up of 4 struggling women who have a strong desire to get ahead. The following details the various businesses in which they are engaged: Angela O. V. is an enterprising woman who has been selling chickens for the past 12 years. She is the mother of 4 school-aged children. Angela and her husband work hard so their family will get ahead. Her husband works at a shrimp farm and in their free time, they visit their parents and their brothers. They will use the loan to buy chickens. Lizhet del Carmen O. is an enterprising young woman who makes tortillas in her home and sells them. Lizhet is single and lives with her parents who she helps financially by covering their household expenses. She gets up every day at 4:00 in the morning to make her delicious tortillas and goes out to sell them in the community. In her free time, she goes to church. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, lime, firewood, and water. Blanca Luz O. is a hard-working woman who sells general consumer products. She has a small general store. Blanca gets up at 5:00 in the morning to take care of her customers. She and her husband have helped their family get ahead. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to supply her business. Deysi Isabel V. sells general consumer products. She has owned a general store for the past 6 years. Deysi is the mother of 4 school-aged children. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to take care of her customers and send her children to school. In her free time, she attends church. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to supply her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de gallinas, harina de maiz, cal, leña, agua, fosforos, arroz, azucar, manteca, frijoles, leche, refrescos, aceite, huevos, candelas, sopas, pastas, espaguetis, salsas, margarina, sal, condimentos, sopas instantaneas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz De Vida Group

texts.es:
EL Centro Focal de Panamericana se encuentra al oeste de la ciudad de El Alto.  De una de las zonas cercanas, ha nacido la asociación “Luz de Vida”, y ahora se encuentran con la disposición de iniciar un segundo ciclo.  El grupo está compuesto por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón. 
La señora Isabel es la presidenta de la asociación.  Ella comenta que  conoció a Pro Mujer debido a la invitación de la promotora.  El negocio que lleva adelante es la venta de frutas y “artesanía en mantas”.  Aprendió artesanías en manta de su madre, trabajo con ella cuatro años.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs.1500.- y le sirvió para comprar lana de alpaca. Para este nuevo crédito está solicitando Bs.2500.- para la compra de lana de vicuña.
La lana es comprada de la Feria 16 de Julio y las ventas son realizadas los jueves y domingo de 6:30 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. en la misma feria.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que  le gusta todo, en particular compartir en la reunión con sus compañeras.

Los integrantes de la asociación comunal, cuentan con negocios diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de coca, venta de lana de vicuña, artesanía en mantas, carnicería, tienda de barrio, venta de tarjetas.
texts.en:
The Panamericana Focal Center is in the west side of the city of El Alto. Form a nearby area the “Luz de Vida” (Light of Life) association has emerged. They are now ready to start their second cycle. The group is composed of nine people, eight women and one man. Isabel is association President. She comments that she became aware of Pro Mujer thanks to the invitation from a promoter. Her business is fruit sales and artisanal blanket weaving. She learned how to weave blankets from her mother. She worked with her for four years. Her first loan was for Bs.1500 and she used it to buy alpaca wool. This new requested loan is for Bs.2500 and it will be used to buy vicuña wool. The wool is bought at the 16 de Julio market and sales are Thursdays and Sundays from 6:30am until 11am at the same market. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she answered that she liked everything about it but in particular sharing in the meetings with her fellow group members. The group members have a variety of different businesses. Some sell coca leaves, other sell vicuña wool. Some are blanket weavers, butchers, grocers and telephone card salespeople.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Kpossidé

texts.fr: A. est une jeune femme célibataire et a une personne à sa charge, elle exerce depuis 8 ans déjà le commerce de céréales, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente d'ignames. elle s'approvisionne quelques fois au grand marché de Lomé mais plus souvent à l'intérieur du pays dans les villes de sokodé et atakpamé. elle veut accroître ces recettes et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit qui va lui servir à acheter des sacs de céréales et 10 tas d'ignames.
texts.en:
Kpossidé A. is a young unmarried woman who supports one other person. She has been engaged in the business of selling grains for 8 years. She later began a secondary business selling yams. She sometimes stocks up at Lomé's large market, but more often in the interior of the country, in the towns of Sokodé and Atakpamé. She wants to increase her revenue and therefore is requesting a loan from WAGES which will enable her to buy some bags of grains and 10 lots of yams.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Sonia Germania

texts.es:
Sonia de 49 años, vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. Su actividad principal es vender ropa. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella comenzó a vender ropa de niños a sus vecinos y conocidos, poco a poco obtuvo clientela para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Vende blusas a $ 8.00, pantalones a $ 15.00, short a $ 6.00. 

Ella quiere seguir ayudando con los gastos familiares por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y zapatos. En el futuro quiere tener una boutique de ropa.
texts.en:
Sonia, 49, lives in an urban zone called “Las Orquídeas” so called because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids there. Her main activity is clothing sales. Because of a lack of employment opportunities she started selling children’s clothes to her neighbors and acquaintances. Gradually she acquired clientele that helped her meet family expenses. She sells blouses for $8.00, pants for $15.00 and shorts for $6.00. She wants to continue to help meet family expenses so she wants to use the loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future she’d like to have a clothing boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Guadalupe Mercedes

texts.es: Guadalupe Mercedes tiene 40 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, sus inicios se dan con esfuerzos propios por lo que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo y necesitaba ofrecerles alimento, vestimenta entre otras cosas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. El financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, toallas, cosméticos, calzado y ropa. Ella sueña con establecer un local en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Mercedes is 40 years old. She sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 7 years. She started the business on her own since she had two young children and needed to feed, clothe and provide everything else for them. She is an entrepreneur who is always looking for ways to increase her income. She requests the loan to purchase merchandise such as linens, towels, cosmetics, shoes and clothing to sell. She dreams on opening a shop where she could offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvira Leticia

texts.es:
Elvira de 40 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa,  vive en  una zona urbana “Los Vergeles” caracterizada por la gran población de personas. Su esposo es chofer ellos tienen dos hijos de 17 y 11 años. 

Comenzó a vivir en vergeles desde que se caso, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ella invirtió sus ahorros en papelería. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am, vende todo tipo de papelería, aunque por donde vive los caminos son de tierra sigue trabajando para darles una mejor vida a su familia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería y artículos de papelería. En el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su casa y tener un departamento para alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Elvira, 40, has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house. She lives in an urban zone called “Los Vergeles” which is quite heavily populated. Her husband is a driver and they have two children who are 17 and 11 years old. She has lived in Vergeles since she got married. To help her husband meet family expenses she invested her savings in a stationery store. Since then and to the present day she works from 7am. She sells all kinds of stationery items. Although she lives in a neighborhood with unpaved streets she continues to work to give her family a better life. The loan will be used to buy stationery items. In the future she’d like to fix up her house better and own an apartment to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For paper goods.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: H. est une femme de 37 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle y a associé plus tard le commerce de charbons. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce. elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d'adidogomé, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays pour gagner plus de marge bénéficiare. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle constate une baisse de son stock et elle veut rapidement se réapprovisionner pour éviter une rupture de stock, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ms. H. is a 37-year old woman. She makes a living by selling cereals. In addition, she also started selling charcoal. She has three years of experience in the business. She sells at the local market of Adidogomé and stocks up in the interior part of the country in order to increaser her profit margin. Her customer base is very diverse. At present her stock is low and she would like to replenish it quickly in order to avoid running out of stock. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 bags of corn and 10 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn and charcoal

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Triunfo es integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, tienen varios años de conocerse y son personas humildes y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

doña Aura Leticia V. es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su  negocio el cual es la venta de golosinas  en la escuela de su comunidad, Aura es madre de 5 hijos, los mas grandes le ayudan a la venta de golosinas. 
Aura y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante su familia.
Aura se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar  las ricas golosinas y sus tiempos libres lo dedica la familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.

Virginia de jesus A. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de dulces en su casa de habitacion, tiene 15 años de realizar este tipo de actividad. Virginia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya son profesionales.  Virginia y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante el hogar.
doña Virginia vende sus dulces a los alumnos que pasan por su casa. su tiempo libre lo dedica para asistir a la iglesia.

don Jose M. es una persona trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañon desde hace 7
años en su comunidad.
don Jose y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, tienen 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela.
Jose se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para despulpar la semilla y asi venderla.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de marañon.
texts.en:
The “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) group is composed of two women and one man. They have known each other for several years and are humble folk with a strong wish to get ahead. Following are details on the different activities they carry out: Aura Leticia V. is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her business of selling snacks in her local school. She has five children. The oldest ones help out in the snack shop. Aura and her husband work hard to help the family succeed. Aura rises at 5am to prepare the delicious snacks and she spends her free time with her family. The loan will be used to buy ingredients to make the snacks. Virginia de Jesús A. is an enterprising woman who sells candy in her home. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has two children who are now professionals. She and her husband work hard for their home’s success. Virginia sells candy to students that pass by her house. In her free time she goes to church. José Martínez is a hard working person who has sold cashews for the last 7 years in his community. He and his wife work hard together to have their family succeed. They have 4 children who are in school. José rises daily at 6am to dehusk the seeds for sale. He will use the loan to buy cashew nuts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortillas, lard, cooking oil, salt, condiments, beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, cheese, sugar, artificial flavorings and cashews.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: yawa est une femme divorcée qui a une personne à sa charge, l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges est le commerce de produits génériques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante et l'a commencé en 2007. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de s'approvisionner avec 4 cartons de produits génériques.
texts.en:
Yawa is a divorced woman with one dependent. She makes a living by selling basic need goods. She has been working as a street vendor since 2007. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé. The loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase fours boxes of various basic need goods.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing four boxes of basic need goods

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena C. operates a provisions shop in Elmina. She is married to a carpenter and has six dependants. She has no formal education. Helena uses her income to help her husband look after the general welfare of the home. Helena will use this loan to purchase more provisions to sell. Helena plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to establish another shop in a different area.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia Del Carmen de 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia. Ella tiene el negocio de su pulpería, está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El trabajo es tranquilo, pues no sale de su casa, ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Como es una dama muy trabajadora, trabaja todos los días para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes. Lo que fue más difícil fue superar la competencia pero ella siempre brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia Del Carmen is 46 years old. She owns her own house and this is where her store is located. Since she has two small children, she doesn't leave the house much and her work is relaxed. She is also a very hard-working woman and works every day to defray the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies and detergent. What she finds most difficult is to beat her competition, but she always gives good customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies and detergent

loans.name: Rina Pilar

texts.es:
Rina D. 48 años, tiene una pequeña papelería muy surtida en L. parte delantera D. su casa. Vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Cuando comenzó a vivir en su casa vio que por el sector no había papelerías, y como necesitaba un ingreso adicional compro papelería con sus ahorros y empezó a venderlos. Poco a poco fue incrementando L. clienteL. hasta ahora que trabaja desD. las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm. VenD. también zapatos y ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería y zapatos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y local.
texts.en:
Rina, 48, has a small, well stocked stationery shop in the front part of her house. She lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas” so called because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids there. When she started to live in her house she noticed that there were no stationery shops in her area. Because they needed additional income she used her savings to buy stationery items and started to sell them. Gradually her clientele grew and she now works from 7:30am until 7pm. She also sells shoes and clothing. She wants to use the loan to buy stationery items and shoes for her shop. In the future she’d like to make improvements to her home and to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stationery items, notebooks, pens.

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cajina lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Blanca Almendares quien inicio  vendiendo esquimo. En la actualidad comercializa de ropa, negocio en el que invertirá el crédito  y con el cual tiene la meta poner una pequeña tienda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Lidia M. Dávila quien comercializa reposterías, chocobananos y helados que ella misma elabora mientras Ana Virginia P. Martínez tiene una pequeña fritanga.
texts.en:
The group Cajina is made up of three hard-working women. One of these women is Blanca Almendares who started out selling Eskimo products. Currently, she sells clothing. She will use the loan to invest in this business. Her goal is to have her own small store. The other members of the group are María Lidia M. Dávila, who sells pastries, chocolate covered bananas and ice cream that she makes herself, and Ana Virginia P. Martínez who runs a small restaurant that makes authentic, home cooked, Nicaraguan foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Mixy

texts.en:
Mixy belongs to the communal bank “Feria Fluvial” located in Valdivia. She has a stand where she sells fish and shrimp in the fair “Feria Fluvial” in the city.  This fair is part of a commercial part of the city beside the river Calle Calle, and this explains the name of the fair, as "fluvial" refers to a body of water, river or lake.
  
Mixy´s stand has been part of the family business for at least 60 years, when her grandmother used to run the business. She has run the stand for the past eight years along with her mother and aunt.  With this loan, Mixy would like to purchase a freezer to store the pre-cooked shrimp and sell them to local restaurants. 

She is the mother of four: 19, 17, and 10 year olds and a newborn only six months old. Only the three youngest reside with her. Mixy dreams of owning her own house, for which she applied for a mortgage and will receive news by the end of September. 

Mixy likes that the payments to Fondo Esperanza are weekly, as they allow her to ask for how much she needs and is able to pay it little by little.  She is also pleased with the disposition of her loan officer, as she is available to advise and teach her skills on how to run a business. 

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos region.  It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile.  Among Valdivia's principal economic activities are the metallurgy industry, naval construction, wood production, paper and cellulose production, beer factories, and milling.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Kama

texts.fr: kama est une jeune femme célibataire, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle réside dans le quartier d'agbalépédo et c'est dans ce même quartier qu'elle exerce son commerce. voulant se réapprovisionner elle demande de WAGES un crédit qui est son premier qui lui permettra  d'acheter 22 sacs de charbons de bois. C'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Kama is a young, single woman. She makes a living selling charcoal. She lives in the Agbalépédo neighbourhood and also runs her business there. In order to restock her business, she is requesting her first WAGES loan, which will allow her to buy 22 bags of charcoal. Kama supports herself with the revenue generated by her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 22 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Don Felix Pedro M. es un señor emprendedor que se dedica la venta de peroles, ollas, caserolas, freideras, tiene su puesto en el mercado de chlouteca desde hace 12 años.
Felix es padre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en una escuela publica.
Felix se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a su puesto en el mercado de Choluteca para vender sus productos.
junto con su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia. 
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a la iglesia de su comunidad.  
el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar mas utencilios de cocina y asi incrementar sus ventas para tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro Martínez is an enterprising man who sells casseroles, pots and pans. His stand has been in Choluteca’s market for 12 years. Félix has 4 children who go to public school. He gets up at 4am to go to his stand in the Choluteca market to sell his products. Together with his wife he works hard for his family’s wellbeing. He spends his free time visiting his community’s church. He needs the loan to buy more kitchen utensils to increase sales and have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy casseroles, pots and frying pans.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Garciela, who belongs to the communal bank “Feria Fluvial” in Valdivia, operates a stand of fruits and vegetables in the fair “Feria Fluvial,” located by the Calle Calle River pier, fifteen minutes from her home. This stand has belonged to Garciela´s family for the past 15 years, when it was attended by Graciela's mother. She works seven days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. along with her husband, and she plans to use this loan to purchase more fruits and seasonal vegetables.

Garciela is a mother of two children, but only her 24-year-old still lives with her as he pursues studies in psychology. Garciela dreams of owning her own house, which she applied for a year ago, and would also like to purchase a truck so that she can travel to Temuco, a city located about an hour from Valdivia, to purchase merchandise.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos region. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile. Amongst Valdivia's principal economic activities are the metalurgy industry, naval construction, wood production, paper and celulose production, beer factories, and milling.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el nivel primario, Raquel tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle concurrida, negocio que inicio hace 7 años, cuenta con la ayuda de 3 personas que le ayudan,  actividad que inicia a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, también vende golosinas.
Raquel es socia del Banco Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de gaseosas y para implementar una jugueria.
Los sueños de Raquel son aperturar otro restaurante en el centro de la ciudad y tener un recreo grande.
texts.en:
Raquel is married and has two children in primary school. She has a restaurant in a rented locale on a busy street. She started the business 7 years ago and has three employees that help her. She starts working at 5am and continues until 10pm. She also sells snacks. Raquel is a member of the Las Golondrinas (The Swallows) communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy soft drinks and to set up a juice bar. Raquel’s dreams are to open a second restaurant downtown and to have a large country tourist stop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and to install a juice bar.

loans.name: Yedoukoua

texts.fr: N. est une femme de  47 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle a une ancienneté de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle dresse son étalage de marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. elle s'approvisionne à Lomé, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter  10 cartons de boîtes de conserve, 6 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gblinkomé.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a 47 year old woman who runs a revenue-generating business selling general food products. She has ten years of experience in this business. She dresses her window display with her merchandise at the front of her store. She stocks up in Lomé. She is asking WAGES for a second loan to buy 10 boxes of canned goods, 6 boxes of pasta and other diverse food products. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Gblinkomé.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Amelia G. es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su trabajo, Rosa es viuda desde hace 15 años y vive con su hija y sus dos nietas.
Rosa se levanta todos los dias a las 6 de la mañana para atender su negocio que son los apartamentos.
verificar que esten bien limpios y revisar que todo este funcionando a la perfeccion. 
el credito lo utilizara para hacerle unas mejoras a los apartamentos.
en su tiempo libre visita la iglesia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Amelia G. is a very hard working and dedicated woman. Rosa has been a widow for 15 years and lives with her daughter and her two granddaughters. Rosa gets up at 6 o'clock in the morning every day to attend to her apartment business. She has to verify that they are all clean and functioning perfectly. She will use the loan to make improvements to the apartments. In her free time she goes to church.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es:
Zaragoza es socia  del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Zaragoza es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Zaragoza tiene un carro que realiza transporte interprovincial a la ciudad de Vilcas Huaman, Zaragoza se encarga de la administración y en algunas oportunidades hace tamales que vende en su barrio.
Zaragoza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de repuestos para su carro.
Los sueños de Zaragoza es tener mas carro y tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows). She is married and has two children who are university students.

Zaragoza has a car that she uses to provide interprovincial transportation services from the city of Vilcas Huaman. She is in charge of managing the vehicle and also takes advantage of a few opportunities to make tamales and sell them in her neighborhood.

Zaragoza needs a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can buy spare parts for her car. She dreams of acquiring another car and opening a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for her car

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Santiago se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 19 años tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre está aportando lo mejor para mantener su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento por lo que ha sido muy importante, para salir adelante. Por lo que el viaja a diferentes departamentos para buscar los diferentes productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y artículos para el hogar. El sueña con mejorar el servicio con sus clientes y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Santiago makes a living selling general merchandise. He has been supporting his three children for more than 19 years. He is always contributing his best to maintain his business. This is not the first loan that has been very important in his goal to get ahead. He travels to other departments to look for the differing products that his customers request. The loan is for the purchase of towels, sheets, cosmetics, shoes and home goods. He dreams of improving his service to his customers and making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es soltera y vive en la casa de su mama, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado del Cementerio en donde vende especerías que ella misma prepara, además Maria tiene una juguetería en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, negocio que inicio hace 2 meses y le esta yendo bien.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de juguetes.
Los sueños de Maria es mejorar sus negocios y surtir con mas productos.
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives at home with her mother. She has a stand at the Cementerio Market where she sells spices that she prepares herself. Maria also manages a toy store from a rented location in the central part of the city. She started this business two months ago and it is doing well.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows) and needs a loan of 2500 PEN to buy toys. Her dreams are to improve her businesses and be stocked with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys to sell

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Brigida es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Brigida se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, los ofrece de casa en casa sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito.
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa.
Brigida sueña con terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows). She is in a common law marriage and has four children who are in school. Brigida buys and sells cheeses and travels house to house to offer her products. Most of her sales are made on credit.

Brigida needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy construction materials for her house. She dreams of finishing the construction of her house and seeing her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos son gemelas, Sandra se dedica al engorde de animales en su casa, compra animales flacos y luego los engorda para vender en carne. Además Sandra vende frutas, golosinas y gaseosas cerca del camal de Quicapata.
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Sandra son darle un buen acabado a su casa y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra has three children, two of them girls, and lives with a partner. She makes a living raising animals in her home. She buys skinny animals and fattens them up to sell for meat. Sandra also sells fruit, candies and sodas near the Quicapata slaughterhouse. Sandra is a member of the community bank Las Golondrinas and is requesting a loan of 1000 soles for the purchase of pigs. Sandra dreams of polishing up her house and having a store at her residence.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Lola viaja una vez a la semana a la feria en donde vende panes y frutas, y de allá compra ajo que luego reparte en la ciudad de Ayacucho. También compra y vende quesos. Lola vende comida en su casa y da pensión.
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de ajo.
Lola sueña con mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lola is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She travels once a week to the fair where she sells breads and fruits. While she is there, Lola purchases garlic that she will distribute later in the city of Ayacucho. She also buys and sells cheeses. Lola sells food from her house and at a dining hall.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows) and needs a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy garlic. Lola dreams of making improvements to her house and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic

loans.name: Jessica Rocio

texts.es:
Jessica de 20 años, tiene una tienda pequeña pero bien surtida de víveres, vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite ya que el papa fue una motivación para que ella tuviera su tienda, poco a poco con esfuerzo y algunos sacrificios, ahora trabaja en su propio negocio a tan corta edad. Tiene un hijo de un año y por el trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar un congelador para su tienda, en el futuro quiere ampliar mas su negocio y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 20 years old and has a small store that is well-stocked with provisions. She lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas”, which was named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered.

As a result of the demand for provisions, Jessica began buying canned goods, rice, and oil. Her father motivated her to open her store. With a little bit of effort and some sacrifices, she now works in her own business for someone who is so young. Jessica has a one year old child and works every day from 7:30am until 10pm.

She plans to use the loan to buy a freezer for her store. In the future, she wants to expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Ligia Group

texts.es:
El grupo doña Ligia lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ligia del Rosario Carrión Cuadra quien vende todo un poco desde ropa, cosméticos, zapatos, sopa etc. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años y su meta es que su negocio crezca.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ruth V. Ramirez quien vende fresco y Elena Blandón Zarrier quien comercializa ropa, perfumes y zapatos.
texts.en:
Doña Ligia’s group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Ligia del Rosario Carrión Cuadra, who sells a little bit of everything from clothes, cosmetics, shoes, to soups and other items. She started this business eight years ago. Her goal is to grow her business.

The other members of the group are Ruth V. Ramirez, who sells refreshments, and Elena Blandón Zarrier who sells clothing, perfumes, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and other products

loans.name: Juana Valentina

texts.es:
la sra. Juana Valentina Z. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Juana vive en la colonia Araujo de la ciudad de Choluteca.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.
Juana es madre de 2 hijas, mayores de edad y que le ayudan en su negocio.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a la cria de cerdos y gallinas.   
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Valentina Z. sells popular consumer products. She has a small store located in her home. Juana lives in the Araujo subdivision in the city of Choluteca. Every day she wakes up at 5am so that she can attend to her customers. Juana is the mother of two grown daughters who help her with the business. During her free time, she raises pigs and chickens.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise to restock her business since the demands of her customers are numerous. The earnings are needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 51 años, su negocio es una pulpería. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado interactuar con sus clientes. En su negocio ofrece golosinas, refrescos, detergentes, granos básicos y sopas, Comenzó a trabajar por la falta de oportunidades. Inicio con muy pocos productos  pues la mayoría de sus vecinos llegaban a comprar lo que ella ofrecía,  ahora ella abre su pulpería desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Por lo que tuvo que trabajar mucho para conseguir lo que hoy en día tiene. Ella solicita este financiamiento para materia prima.
texts.en:
Concepción is 51 years old and manages a grocery store. She always enjoys interacting with her customers. In her business she offers snacks, soft drinks, detergents, basic grains, and soups. Concepción began working due to a lack of opportunities. She started with very few products, but most of her neighbors came to buy whatever she offered. Now her store is open from 7am until 9pm. She has had to work very hard to achieve what she has today.

Concepción is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Akou Akpéné

texts.fr: H. aku akpéné est une jeune femme de 29 ans, elle est divorcée et a deux personnes à sa charge, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit qui va lui permettre d'acheter 20 pagnes de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
Akou Akpéné H. is a young 29 year old woman. She is divorced and cares for two people. She runs a revenue-generating, travelling business selling cloth. Her customer base is composed of all sorts of people. She has already obtained a loan from WAGES, which she has completely repaid. She is asking WAGES for a second loan which will permit her to buy 20 cloths of different qualities.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
doña Emilia R. M. es una mujer muy trabajadora y  que se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que su negocio le genera a mantenido a sus hijos, tiene 5 hijos.
Emilia y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante su hogar.
la ropa la vende en varios lugares cercanos de su comunidad.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, en estos momentos tiene varios pedidos y no tiene capital para comprar la ropa.
texts.en:
Emilia R. M. is a very hard-working woman. She has been selling second-hand clothing (popularly named by the public American Clothes) for several years. She uses the income generated by her business to support her children; she has five children. Emilia and her husband work hard to get their household ahead. She sells the clothes in various nearby places in her community. She also raises chickens. She will use the loan to buy clothes. She now has many orders, and she does not have the capital to buy the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's outfits, dresses, shirts, pants, socks, and pajamas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ines Dilenia

texts.es:
la joven Ines Dilenia R. se dedica a la  venta de dulces y refrescos desde hace 5 años, 
es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan pequeños, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a la crianza de cerdos y tambien visita la iglesia de su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de confites, churros, galletas, bombones, pirulines, paletas, chicles, refrescos para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Young Ines Dilenia R. has sold candies and soft drinks for 5 years. She is a mother of 2 small children. She and her husband work hard to get their children ahead. In their free time they raise hogs and visit the community church. This loan will be used for the purchase of confectionery, fritters, cookies, candies, suckers, lollipops, gum and pop to increase her sales and thus have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of confectionery, fritters, cookies, candies, suckers, lollipops, gum, and pop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abra Délali

texts.fr: A. est une femme de 34 ans très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits génériques, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 8 ans ce qui a fait qu'elle maîtrise tous les contours de ce commerce. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  10 cartons de produits génériques pour se réapprovisionner. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
A., 34, is a very dynamic lady who has been earning income selling generic products for more than 8 years. Over that period, she has learned a lot about selling this sort of merchandise. She has noticed that her inventory is low so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 cases of generic products for resale. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic products

loans.name: David Elias

texts.es: El Señor David vive en alquiler tiene dos hijitos que están estudiando en el colegio su esposa trabaja en una empresa y vende ropa. Ella le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El señor esta trabajando en una línea   que va por Temporal hasta Pucara, cuando tiene días libres trabaja como taxista para tener mas ingresos, el crédito que le dimos utilizara para comprar llantas e incrementar para la compra de  un vehículo y este lo hará trabajar con chofer así tendrá mas ingresos y les dará mejores condiciones  de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
David rents where he lives, and he has two children who go to school. His wife works for a company, and she sells clothes. She helps him with the household expenses. This man is working on a line that goes from Temporal to Pucara. On his days off he works as a taxi driver to get more income. He will use the loan to buy tires and to increase what he has in order to buy a vehicle. Then he will have a driver work with the vehicle, and he will get more income. This will give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and increase what he has in order to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Victor Adrian

texts.es:
Victor B. es  de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 2do año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables en la Universidad Catòlica de la misma  ciudad.

Su madre es peluquera y  su padre es funcionario pùblico; tambien es comerciante, por lo que Victor se vió en la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres en administración del mismo. Con esto irá adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtendrá un ingreso para sus estudios.

Tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, ser un profesional para así poder ejercer y contar con un buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia, ya que es el mayor entre los hijos.

El solicita el préstamo para el pago de matrícula de su facultad y también para la compra de libros y materiales que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Victor B. is from the city of Carapeguá, is 20 years old and is starting his second year studying Accounting Sciences at the Universidad Catolica in Carapeguá. His mother is a hairdresser and his father is a public official as well as a merchant. Victor helps his parents administer his father's business, which helps him gain experience and earn an income to help pay for his studies. He wants very much to finish his studies and become a working professional in order to exercise what he has learned and earn a good income so that he can help his family, since he is the oldest child. Victor is requesting this loan to pay his matriculation fees and to buy the books and study materials he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Pay matriculation fees for this semester, buy study materials and books

loans.name: Ingris Francisca

texts.es:
la joven Ingris Francisca H. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la colonia El Centro en la ciudad de Choluteca, Ingris se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el mercado de su comunidad, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a comprar los mariscos que vende diario.
Ingris es soltera vive con su mama y su hermana,  no tiene hijos.
su tiempo libre se lo dedica a su madre y tambien asiste a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mariscos y asi tener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Ingris Francisca H. is 22 years old. She lives in downtown Choluteca. Ingris sells sea food in her community's market. Every day she gets up at 4 in the morning to go buy the sea food that she sells every day. Ingris is single and lives with her mother and her sister. She has no children. She spends her free time with her mother and she also helps at church. She will use the loan to buy more seafood and have increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
doña Florentina Z. M. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la Libertad Salida al poso de Agua en el Triunfo Choluteca, Florentina se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y es muy dedicada a su negocio, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para elaborar su pan y luego salir a venderlo a la calle.
Florentina es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales le ayudan a vender su producto cuando tienen tiempos libres.
Florentina tambien se dedica a la cria de cerdos y gallinas en su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de sus panes.
texts.en:
Florentina Z. M. is 43 years old. She lives in the La Libertad Salida neighborhood in Poso de Agua, in El Triunfo Choluteca. Florentina makes and sells bread. She has been doing this activity for several years and she is very dedicated to her business. She gets up at 4 in the morning to make her bread and later go out and sell it in the street. Florentina is a single mother and she has two children who help to sell her product in their free time. Florentina also raises pigs and chickens at her house. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make her bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, baking powder, lard, sugar, salt, margarine, eggs.

loans.name: Helen Yessenia

texts.es:
la sra. Helen Yessenia C. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Pantanal, El Triunfo Choluteca.
Helen se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. ahora necesita comprar varios cerdos pequeños para engorde ya que se aproxima la navidad y es cuando mas se vende la carne de cerdo ya sea por libras o los cerdos enteros.
Helen es madre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela, su esposo se fue para E.E.U.U. en busca de trabajo.  Lo que mensualmente le manda en remesas lo utiliza para remodelar su casa.
Helen y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cerdos.
texts.en:
Helen Yessenia C. is 32 years old and lives in the El Pantanal, El Triunfo neighborhood of Choluteca. Helen raises and sells hogs and needs to buy several piglets to fatten them up for the Christmas holidays, when pork is in greatest demand, either by the pound or as whole hogs. She is the mother of three children, who attend school. Her husband is working in the United States and she uses the money he sends her monthly to make improvements to their home. Helen and her husband work very hard to move their family ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patricia Gina

texts.es: La Señora Patricia  se dedica a la venta de productos a pedido, desde edredones, ropa, vajillas  hasta vehículos a medio uso, es muy joven y trabaja con el capital propio y del esposo, solicitaron el préstamo ya que tuvo demanda de pedidos ella deja sus productos a crédito y va cobrando semanalmente o quincenalmente, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene dos pequeños hijos, quiere a futuro tener un negocio grande de vehículos a medio uso ya vio que en este negocio existe un poco mas de ganancia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia sells products to order, including comforters, clothing, tableware, and even used vehicles. She’s young and works with her own capital and that of her husband. They requested this loan because they have orders to fill. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or biweekly. She is very hard working and has two young children. In the future she wants to start a large used vehicle business, now that she realizes that this type of business brings in a bit more income. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Solange Del Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Solange es viuda vive con sus hijos pero ellos trabajan independientemente, se dedica al comercio de ropa llevando ropa de temporada a las ferias de pueblos de lugares cálidos de nuestra ciudad, ella trabaja con mercadería de buena calidad por lo que sus ventas son buenas, quiere a futuro comprar una movilidad para llevar su mercadería ella misma ya que el gasto de transporte es mucho y esto le afecta a sus ingresos, ella es muy trabajadora, esta muy feliz por ser una cliente kiva
texts.en:
Solange is a widow who lives with her children, but they are all on their own. She sells seasonal clothing at the local fairs and warm areas of the city. Her me merchandise is of good quality and her sales are good. In the future she wants to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise herself because she spends too much on transportation and it affects her profits. She is a very hard working woman and she is very happy to be a Kiva client.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
doña Maria Suyapa V. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Carmen en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Maria se dedica a la venta de camarones desde hace 3 años.
Es madre de 5 hijos y los esta educando con la ayuda de su esposo.
Maria se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a comprar el producto y luego a venderlo en varios lugares 
de la comunidad.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica para visitar a su padres y otros familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de hielo y camarones
texts.en:
Maria Suyapa V. is 36 years old and lives in the El Carmen settlement in the city of Choluteca. She is the mother of five children and she and her husband are providing them with an education. She’s been selling shrimp for three years. Maria rises at 5:00 AM every morning to buy the product that she will sell from different areas around her community. She visits her parents and other family members in her spare time. Maria will use the money from this loan to buy shrimp and ice.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shrimp and ice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó a trabajar por la falta de oportunidades ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo, ella trabaja todos los días por lo que tiene ciertos clientes que le hacen muchos pedidos. Para seguir con las ventas ella quiere compra con el préstamo pantalones, camisas, ropa interior entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere ofrecerles a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 32 years old and sells clothing. She’s been in this business for more than four years and started it because there were no other opportunities available. She cares for her two young children and works every day and has regular customers who make many requests of her. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, undergarments, and other things in order to continue with her sales. [Martha] wants to be able to offer better service to her customers in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Señora Yolanda es un cliente que ya trabajo varias secuencias  en la institución esta desde la gestión 2003, en los anteriores crédito demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad, ella se dedica la venta de comida, su puesto esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, que esta en la zona 16 de julio, ella aprovecha la feria que existe en esta zona los días jueves y domingo,  su negocio esta ubicado en la zona 16 de julio, la señora tiene esta actividad varios años y vende lentejas y sopa de maní, la señora esta separada en este momento tiene dos hijos pero ellos son mayores y le ayudan a su madre, la señora invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería por mayor como ser arroz por quintales, fideos y demás, como también en la refacción de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is a client who has already worked on several loan cycles since joining Emprender in 2003. She has demonstrated responsibility and promptness with her previous loans. Yolanda sells food from a stand in her home in the July 16th district. She also takes advantage of the local fairs that occur on Thursdays and Sundays and are located in the July 16th district as well.

Yolanda has several years experience selling lentils and peanut soup. Her two grown children help her even though they do not live with her. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more merchandise such as rice by the quintal (1 quintal = 46kg) and noodles. In addition, she will pay for repairs to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & pay for repairs to her home

loans.name: Alba Alejandrina

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Alejandrina Z. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Danli, Alba se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería negocio que opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “ELSA” y ubicado en su casa de habitación.

Cabe mencionar que las condiciones de vida de la sra. Z. han mejorado notablemente gracias a su negocio.

Doña Alba es casada y su esposo es comerciante,  producto del matrimonio dio a luz a dos hijas de las cuales una esta casada y una en edad media y que en la actualidad esta cursando sus estudios universitarios. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba Alejandrina Z. is 40 years old and lives in the Nueva Esperanza division of the city of Danli. She is a merchant who operates a grocery business under the name “Elsa”, which is located in her home. It should be noted that her living conditions have improved dramatically as a result of her business.

Doña Alba is married and her husband is also a merchant. Two daughters resulted from their marriage. One is married while the younger one is currently attending university. This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business so that she can improve her sales and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es:
Pablo R. está muy contento porque invirtió su primer credikiva muy bien y ya terminó de cancelar, como quiere continuar aumentando su capital está aplicando por su segundo credikiva, al que se hace meritorio porque pagó puntualmente y mejora cada dia mas.
