Con este crédito comprará mercancia de miscelanea, ranchos, viveres y refrescos, preparandose porque ya viene la celebración del dia del amor y la amistad y las fiestas de a finales del año. Si usted puede conocer su historia ingresando al siguiente enlace:  
http://partners.kiva.org/lend//173333
texts.en:
Pablo R. is very pleased, because he invested his first Kiva loan very well and has already paid it off. Since he wants to continue to increase his capital, he is applying for his second Kiva loan, which he qualifies for because he made his payments on time and gradually improved his business. With this loan he will buy miscellaneous merchandise: snacks, groceries and soft drinks, so that he can get ready for the celebrations that are approaching, including the "Day of Love and Friendship" and the festivities that come at the end of the year. If you would like to know more about his background, click on the following link: http://partners.kiva.org/lend//173333

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous merchandise: snacks, groceries, and soft drinks

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria desde hace 8 años, que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 2  hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy responsable, lo que hace la diferencia es que siempre está al pendiente con sus clientes le solicitan. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que tiene la posibilidad de interactuar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria has been selling clothes for a living for the past 8 years. She has two young children for whom she is responsible. This is why she always looks for a way to improve her income. She is a very responsible woman and what makes the difference is that she is always waiting for her customers’ requests. She is requesting a new loan to purchase underwear, pants, shirts, skirts, and suits. What she likes most about her business is that it gives her the opportunity to interact with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Emprendadoras De La Q Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS D. LA Q”
Gloria Rosario N. Hernández tiene 53 años vive en el asentamiento humano José Carlos Mariategui en el distrito D. san Juan D. Lurigancho,es madre D. cuatro hijos ya todos mayores D. edad, hace seis años que Gloria se quedo viuda su esposo falleció y desD. ese momento todo los gastos y responsabilidades D. la casa los asume ella sola.
Gloria se dedica a la venta D. pescado en un mercado cercano donD. vive hace 23 años que viene realizando este negocio con el cual pueD. mantener a su familia,educar a sus hijos y terminar con algunos arreglos D. su casa.
 La alcancia viene trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad desD. el año 2009 este es el cuarto préstamo que realizan con nosotros y su primera experiencia D. la Sra. Gloria como presidenta.
 El sueño D. la Sra.Gloria es convertir su puesto en una distribuidora al por mayor y menor en la venta D. pescado en la más alta calidad y la mejor variedad; por ello el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en incrementar aun más su capital D. trabajo y mediante eso atender a la mayor demanda posible
 la sra Gloria en la foto se encuentra D. pie y viste una chompa azul y una blusa azul floreada
texts.en:
THE COMUNAL BANK "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS D. LA Q" Gloria is 53 years old and lives in the Jose Carlos Mariategui settlement, in the district of San Juan D. Lurigancho. She is the mother of 4 children, all already adults. It has been 6 years since her husband died and Gloria became a widow, and from that moment, all the costs and responsibilities of the house became hers alone. Gloria sells fish in a market near where she lives. She has done this for 23 years in order to maintain her family, educate her children, and finish building her house. The group has worked with Edaprospo-Prosperidad since 2009, and this is the 4th loan they have taken out. This is Gloria's first experience as president. Gloria's dream is to convert her stall into a wholesale and retail distributership and seller of fish of the highest quality and the greatest variety. To do that, the loan will be used to increase her working capital and, in this manner, to satisfy the greatest possible demand. In the photo, Gloria is standing, wearing a blue sweater and a flowered white blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OPEN A NEW STALL IN THE MARKET DUE TO  THE GREAT DEMAND FOR FISH

loans.name: Mujeres Reunidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 8 Kms de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo y para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, a quienes les pareció interesante por ser una  oportunidad crediticia muy buena.
El comité lleva por nombre Mujeres Reunidas debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá de esperanza para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo, integrada por 18  luchadoras señoras, quienes se esmeran días tras días para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.

La Sra. Griselda posee un puesto de venta de comestibles, fabricados por ella misma, a la vez ofrece variedad de bebidas, refrescos, ensaladas, etc.
Desea ampliar el negocio, para lo cual deberá invertir en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, de modo a abaratar los costos, como carnes, huevos, aceites, fideos variados, harina, conservas, verduras, condimentos, etc. para su procesamiento y fabricación de comidas.
 Así mismo desea ampliar la variedad de bebidas para la venta. Estaría abaratando costos siendo que las adquirirá al por mayor a precio de mayorista. Y así podrá incrementar sus ganancias para seguir en el negocio y ampliarlo.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, located a distance of 8 kms from the Paraguarí Office, a group of women met with the objective of increasing their working capital and to undertake productive activities, hence we coordinated the meeting to teach about the program to those who seemed interested because it appeared to be a good financial opportunity. The committee is named Mujeres Reunidas since all the members agree that this opportunity gives them hope to progress. Currently, they are in their fifth cycle (of loans), have 18 hard-working members, who strive day after day to expand their income and provide the best to their respective families. All of the members are very hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective work. Griselda owns a food stall, which she constructed. She sells a variety of drinks, refreshments, salads, etc. She wishes to expand her business for which she needs to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices to cut costs, such as meat, eggs, oil, various noodles, flour, conserves, produce, condiments, etc. so she can make her dishes. At the same time, she wishes to expand the variety of drinks she sells. She could cut costs if she acquired them at wholesale prices. In this manner, she could increase her earnings and continue growing the business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purhcase of produce, oils, meats, noodles, canned goods, condiments, drinks.

loans.name: Roger Ivan

texts.es:
el sr. Roger Ivan R. Quiñonez tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Nueva Esperanza en la ciudad de Danli, Roger se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de articulos para el hogar, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de "Jehová jireh" y que cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en la administración del mismo.
durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar ya que su negocio a crecido y sus condiciones de vida ha mejorado.

Roger vende artículos para el hogar en diferentes partes del departamento de El Paraiso, para lo que utiliza un vehiculo tipo camión el que es de su propiedad y además cuenta con dos empleados.
tiene una gran clientela la que en su mayoría son personas que adquieren los artículos al crédito.

El Sr. Roger es casado su esposa es ama de casa y producto del matrimonio tienen tres hijos, actualmente estan cursando los estudios primarios.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mas articulos para el hogar ya que la demanda es grande y no tiene suficiente capital para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Roger Ivan R. Quiñonez is 33 years old and lives in the Nueva Esperanza "New Hope" residential area in the city of Danli. Roger is a businessman whose primary activity is the sale of items for the home. His business, which he has run for the last three years, is named "Jehová Jireh," or "God Our Provider." During this time he has learned how to be a manager, as evidenced by the growth of his business and improvement in his living conditions. Roger sells items for the home in different parts of the El Paraiso "Paradise" Department. He uses his own truck to do this and also has two employees. He has a large clientele, the majority of whom buy merchandise on credit. Roger is married. His wife takes care of the home and their three children, who are in primary school. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more items for the home, given that demand is high and Roger does not have sufficient capital to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dividers, shelves, and furniture for the bathroom and kitchen.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz  es propietaria de un negocio que es la venta de quesillos de manera ambulante en diferentes universidades. Alba sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto, su esposo trabaja en una bicicleta transportando gente de un lugar a otro por lo que juntos buscan la forma de cómo sobrevivir. Ella es muy famosa por ofrecer estos deliciosos quesillos, sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos por el buen servicio y la buena calidad de sus productos. Está  solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus quesillos. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y además establecer otro puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Luz is the owner of a business selling cheese and she works as a street vendor by different universities. Alba goes out every morning to sell her products. Her husband works with a bicycle transporting people from one place to another. Together they look for ways to support themselves. She is very well-known for her delicious cheese and her customers are very happy with the good service and quality of her products. She is asking for new financing to buy what basic ingredients she needs to make her cheese. Alba dreams of enlarging her business and also of setting up a stand to sell the cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar,  viven en una compañía  denominada Potrero Poi cercana al centro de la ciudad de Itá. Posee una olería ubicada en  la misma compañía, dicha actividad la heredó de su padre hace mas de 10 años. El señor Edgar distribuye a contratistas de obras y a particulares de ladrillos en las ciudades de Itá, Piribebuy y alrededores en el camión de su hermano quien también se dedica a dicha actividad, posee 2 hornos con el cual produce aproximadamente 36.000 ladrillos al mes.
El mismo solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña ya que manifiesta que tiene muchos pedids de ladrillos para construcciones de viviendas para CONAVI (Consejo Nacional para la Vivienda) y el mismo desea satisfacer la demanda de pedidos que tiene.
El señor Edgar opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.007 demostrando puntualidad en el pago de sus obligaciones, en el futuro desea ir aumentando su clientela y mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar, age 40, has two school age children. They live in a well-known area called Potrero Poi, which is close to the center of the city of Itá. He has a business making clay bricks, which is located in the same area. He inherited this activity from his father over 10 years ago. He distributes to work contractors and to individuals in the cities of Itá and Piribebuy and the surrounding areas. He uses his brother’s truck; his brother has the same type of business. He has two ovens, which produce approximately 36,000 bricks per month. He is requesting the loan to buy firewood. He says that he has a lot of orders from CONAVI (National Council for Homes) for bricks for construction. He wants to satisfy the demand for the orders that he has. Edgar has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2007. He demonstrates punctuality with the obligation of his payments. In the future he wishes to get more customers and improve his standard of living and that of his communal bank, Virgen de Rosario del Cusco. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production materials

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Amadu. He is married and has four children aged 2, 4, 8 and 13 years. He has one additional dependant who lives with him because she is his wife's elder mother. 
In 2001, Amadu established a used clothing business. He was financed by his elder brother to start the business as a means of improving his standard of living. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month from his business. 
Amadu would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more stock and make more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Amadu plans to expand his business, build a house for his family, and continue to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Liborio

texts.es: El Señor Liborio vive en la zona norte en el domicilio de sus Padres trabaja como pintor desde muy chico empezó como ayudante, en la actualidad trabaja como contratista en una construcción, en la av.  Rubén Darío el crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos y algunas herramientas que necesita es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito kiva, pero el es muy trabajador. Es soltero y ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Liborio lives in the northern area and in his parents’ house. He worked as a painter and when he was a child, he began as an assistant. He currently works as a construction contractor on Rubén Darío Avenue. He needs the loan to purchase materials and tools that he needs. He is new to Emprender and to the loan from Kiva, but he is very hardworking. He is single and helps his parents with the household expenses. He is very appreciative of Emprender for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools

loans.name: Lazaro Eddy

texts.es: El señor Lázaro Eddy posee un negocio, que es la venta de fajas de cuero de manera ambulante y sus alrededores. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio y la familia las compras las realiza a diferentes proveedores los cuales le ofrecen el producto más favorable. el está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que le están ofreciendo unas fajas a precios más favorables por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su negocio, para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Lázaro Eddy works as a street vendor selling leather belts locally. This is not Lázaro Eddy's first loan; loan proceeds have already been a great help to him and his family, allowing him to make purchases from providers offering the best product. He is requesting a new loan to make additional improvements in his business so that he can provide his family with necessary income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Virgen De La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de la Misericordia es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 31 de Mayo del 2.010, integrado por 20 mujeres de la Ciudad de Villeta. Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Silvia D. se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La Sra. Silvia posee un gallinero, muy bien montado, en el cual se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollitos para su comercialización, ya hace bastante tiempo que se dedica a este ramo y posee una buena clientela ya formada, teniendo en cuenta el consumo de la carne de ave por su economía en comparación a la carne vacuna.
Ella desea ampliar el negocio mediante la inversión en compra de mayor cantidad de pollitos, así también alimentos balanceados y equipos para el suministro de los mismos, para de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo en la producción animal.
texts.en:
The Virgen de la Misericordia Communal Bank is an excellent group, which was formed on May 13th, 2010. It is comprised of 20 women from the city of Villeta. This group formed thanks to Silvia D.. Silvia approached the advisor at a loan renewal meeting in her area to find out more about the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women Program. Silvia was very enthusiastic and eager to be able to work in this program. They are now very happily working in their second cycle with the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women Program. Silvia has a henhouse that is very well established. She raises and fattens chicks in order to sell them. She has worked in this field for quite a while. Taking into account the consumption of poultry instead of beef due to the economy, she now has good, fixed customers. She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more chicks. She will also purchase balanced feed and equipment to provide for the chicks. This way her income will increase, and her animal production will keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get chicks to fatten and raise and for balanced feed

loans.name: Iris Azucena

texts.es:
la sra. Iris Azucena C. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el Matazano Jamastran,  Iris se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría negocio que opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “IRIS” actividad que realiza desde hace varios años y es notable que lo ha sabido administrar ya que durante todo este tiempo su negocio se ha mantenido estable, la ubicación del mismo es muy accesible porque esta a un costado de la carretera principal hacia Trojes contiguo a la clínica del Dr. Gonzalo Lobo por lo que tiene muy buena clientela, las personas de las zonas aledañas acuden a esta clínica y de paso adquieren algunos productos en la pulpería de doña Iris.
Además de la pulpería la Sra. Iris, se dedica a la venta de blusas, sandalias y lociones. la mayoría de las ventas de estos productos las realiza de forma ambulante y al crédito para lo que su esposo le ayuda a vender y a cobrar mientras ella se queda atendiendo la pulpería. 
Cabe mencionar que sus condiciones de vida han mejorado notablemente.
Doña Iris, es casada,  tienen una hija que también esta casada por tal razón que ya no depende económicamente de doña Iris.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Iris Azucena C. is 52 years old and lives in Matazano Jamastran. Iris works in trade, and her main activity is selling groceries. She operates this business under the name of the "IRIS" neighborhood store. She has done this work for several years, and it is worth noting that she has known how to manage it well, since her business has remained stable during all this time. Its location is very accessible, because it is on one side of the main highway toward Trojes, next to the clinic of Dr. Gonzalo Lobo. For this reason, she has a very good customer base; people from areas that are farther away come to this clinic, and on their way, they pick up some products from Iris' neighborhood store. In addition to her store, Iris works selling blouses, sandals and lotions. She makes most of her sales of these products going door to door and selling them on credit. Her husband helps her with this, selling and collecting payments while she is tending the store. It is worth mentioning that her living conditions have improved significantly. Iris is married and has one daughter, who is also married, and thus she no longer depends on Iris economically. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soap, milk, soft drinks, fried snacks, beans, shortening, oil, rice, sugar, tortillas, bread, cookies, coffee, pasta, soups, sauces, toilet paper, batteries, matches, candles, juices, eggs, and salt.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de edad avanzada, muy trabajadora siendo su negocio la venta de tortilla y refrescos desde hace seis años.
Pues le ha tocado trabajar desde joven, ya que ha sido madre soltera lo que ha tenido que trabajar mucho para dar lo necesario a su familia. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con poco y con dinero propio. 
Su casa es de piedra y mitad madera, lo que espera invertir en futuro.
Hoy en día a través del financiamiento como ha venido haciendo invertirá en la compra de varios quintales de maíz, copra de leña, panas para la venta, a si como frutas para hacer variedad de frescos. Y contratar otra muchacha para que le ayude a palmear ya tiene una joven que le ayuda a palmear tortilla el cual le paga setenta córdobas diarios, y no pasar los tres tiempos en el fuego ya que tiene que despachar los refrescos.
Y con esta inversión espera aumentar la producción y lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an older woman who works very hard at her business of six years, which is selling tortillas and fruit juices. She has worked very hard since she was young because she has been a single mother who had to do a lot of work to provide her family with the necessities. When she started her business, she did it with very little and with her own money. Her house is made half of stone, half of wood, and she hopes to invest in it in the future. Now, with this loan, she will invest in the purchase of several quintales [1 quintal = 46kg] of corn, firewood, bowls for selling, and fruits to make a variety of juices. She will also hire another young girl to help her to make the tortillas by hand. She already has a girl who helps her pat the tortillas, who she pays seventy córdobas a day. This way, she will not have to be in front of the fire three times a day, and can tend to distributing the beverages. With this investment, she hopes to increase her production and to bring in more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bowls, and fruits, to increase her sales of tortillas and fruit juices

loans.name: Darlin Marcelino

texts.es: Darlin Marcelino se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene unas cuantas vaquitas, las que le producen un poquito de leche, esta la vende en el pueblo, pero tiene mucha demanda por lo que tiene que comprar y vender más leche para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.  Por lo que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de leche y la compra de una vaca, para ir incrementando su ganado. Con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias, para mantener a su familia y el hogar.
texts.en:
Darlin Marcelino has sold dairy products for over 6 years. He has some cows that produce a little milk to sell in the village, but demand is so high that he has to buy and sell more milk to meet customer demand. That’s why he is requesting this loan to buy milk and a cow to increase his livestock. With this loan he hopes to make more profits to support his family and household.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk and a cow

loans.name: Morlai

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Morlai, a married father of 7 children aged 5, 7, 9, 13, 17, 19 and 21 years. He has one additional dependent living with him because she is a widow. In 1972, Morlai established his cotton and brillian material business. He got the initial business from a younger brother, believing it would bring income that would help him provide a livelihood for his family. Working 11 hours a day, 7 days a week, he earns about 350,000SLL each month from this business.

Morlai is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000SLL to help him buy more clothes and other textile materials for resale, and hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 220,000SLL. In the future, Morlai plans to expand his business, renovate his house and continue to educate his children to the university level. High transportation cost is the major challenge of his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more cotton material to his business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en el departamento de el Beni ciudad ganadera de Bolivia, vive hace 40 años en el departamento de Santa Cruz, su esposa con la cual tiene dos hijos adultos, es profesora educadora de profesión, hoy en día esta jubilada, por tal motivo se dedica a las labores domesticas, el destino del crédito es para comprar una motosierra, ya que su ocupación es la de carpintero y también se encarga de  la venta de madera, es muy conocido en la zona por la calidad en su trabajo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the town of La Guardia, which is 20 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is originally from the department of El Beni, Bolivia's cattle ranching region, and has lived in the department of Santa Cruz for 40 years. His wife, with whom he has two adult children, is a school teacher by profession, but is now retired so she can to spend her time on domestic duties. The purpose of this loan is to buy a power saw, as he is a carpenter by occupation and is also in charge of selling wood. He is very well known in the region for the quality of is work, and is very grateful to the institution for the support it gives him.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Fernando Alfredo

texts.es:
Fernando tiene la edad de 23 años, casado, de oficio agente aduanero, vive junto a su abuelita, en donde ha dado un cuarto que ha venido mejorando.
Lleva cinco años trabajando en la misma empresa, lo que está contento por conservar su puesto. Ya que anteriormente trabajaba de bar ténder y no ganaba  bien.
Lo que más desea es tener su propia casa, lo cual espera a futuro hacer.  Mientras tanto quiere cambiar el techo del cuarto donde vive ya que con estas lluvias se le ha pasado el agua. Y que atreves del financiamiento comprar láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, pintura, y cambiar. Ya que por no contar con el dinero suficiente no lo había hecho el cambio.
texts.en:
Fernando is 23 years old, married, and works as a customs agent. He lives with his grandmother, who gave him a room that he has been making improvements to. He has been working in the same company for five years and is happy to have kept his job, because previously he worked as a bartender and did not make good money. His greatest desire is to have his own house, which he hopes to have in the future. In the mean time, he wants to replace the roof of the room where he lives, because with the rains, water has leaked through. He will buy corrugated metal sheets, wooden beams, nails, and paint with this loan, and will replace the roof. Because he hasn't had enough money to do so, he hasn't replaced it before now.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, wooden beams, nails, and paint (to replace the roof of his room)

loans.name: Silvia Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Silvia Ondina C. tiene más de dos años de dedicarse a cuidar estudiantes,  ya que por la amplitud de la casa en donde vive le permite realizar este tipo de negocio.- actualmente esta cuidando ocho estudiantes a los cuales les brinda la alimentación y pensión.
La Sra. Silvia C. utilizara el credito para comprar la alimentacion y otros materiales para el aseo de los apartamentos y asi darles un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos.

La Sra. Silvia es casada, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad del INA y producto del matrimonio ella dio a luz a tres hijos los que dependen económicamente de ellos, y en estos momento sus hijos están cursando su educación secundaria.
texts.en:
Silvia Ondina C. has looked after students for more than two years, as the spaciousness of the house where she lives allows her to have this type of business.- currently she is looking after eight students to whom she provides food and lodging. Silvia C. will use the loan to buy food and other materials for cleaning the apartments so that she can provide to better service to her tenants. Silvia is married, her husband works as a security guard for INA and they have had three children who depend on them financially, and currently her children are in middle school.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy food, cleaning products for apartments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre trabajador, pequeño comerciante que ha logrado crecer gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado.
Su negocio es la venta de cd y películas el cual lleva once años en las ventas el cual tiene un local pequeño pero también vende ambulante para lograr vender ya que las ventas se  ponen bajas y tiene que buscar la forma de recorrer dinero para lograr cubrir los gastos.
Su casa la ha venido mejorando también con los financiamiento ha logrado hacer un bajarete, repello a las paredes, compro puertas nuevas. Hoy con este préstamo hará un cuarto en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, bloques, cemento hierro, láminas de zinc, perlines y comenzar hacer su cuarto logrando mejor espacio para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a working man. He is a small businessman who has been able to grow thanks to the loans AFODENIC has offered to him. His business of the last 11 years is selling CDs and movies. He has a small storefront but he also sells on foot because his sales have been dropping, so he has to look for a way to make enough money to cover expenses. He has also been using the loans to make improvements to his house. He has built a small covered patio, reinforced the walls, and bought new doors. Now, with this loan, he will build another room. He will buy construction materials like rock, sand, cinder blocks, cement, iron bars, corrugated metal sheets, and roof beams, and he will start to build a room to give his family a better living space.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make his family more comfortable by buying construction materials like rock, sand, cement, iron bars, corrugated metal sheets, etc., and building another room towards the back of his house

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es: La señora Alma Nidia posee una farmacia ubicada cerca de la antigua estación del ferro carril 2c abajo. Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de diversidad de medicamentos. Ya que esta farmacia es bien solicitada por los clientes, debido a que los precios del medicamento son más baratos que en otras junto a su esposo han logrado salir adelante con el negocio. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos. Sus hijos se encuentran estudiando. Ella sueña con mejorar su negocio cada día más y también el servicio.
texts.en:
Ms. Alma Nidia owns a pharmacy located near the old 2c Abajo railroad station. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of medicines. Her pharmacy is popular with customers because the medication prices are lower than other pharmacies. Together with her husband, Ms. Alma Nidia has been able to move forward with her business. She is always looking for a way to create profits. Her children are in school. She dreams of improving her business a little more each day, and she also wants to improve her service.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicines

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, D. 52 años, está casada con Raúl D. 60 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos pero vive solo con dos D. ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo D. Pian. Todos los días desD. muy temprano sale a vender menestras en el mercado central D. su comunidad; con el dinero que obtiene compra los alimentos del día, pero la actividad que más le gusta a Felicita es la agricultura, ya que hace 25 años se dedica a ello, sembrando, zanahoria y espinaca, productos D. los cuales después venD. en la capital del país. 
Estar en el campo es lo que le agrada D. su trabajo, “es tranquilo”, afirma, es por ello que quiere más adelante comprar su propio terreno para sembrar mayor cantidad D. verduras y poder tener mayor capital. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y le encanta pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque aprenD. mucho en las charlas educativas que le brindan constantemente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para  poder sembrar.
texts.en:
Felicita, age 52, is married to 60 year old Raúl. They have six children, but they only live with two of them. They live in their own house in the town of Pian. She leaves very early everyday to sell vegetables in the central market in her community. With the money that she gets she buys food for the day. However, the activity that Felicita likes best is farming. She has been farming for 25 years. She plants carrots and spinach, products that she later sells in the capital of the country. It pleases her to work in the fields. She says that it is peaceful. That is why she wants to later buy her own land to plant a greater quantity of vegetables and be able to have more capital. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is delighted to belong to her communal bank because she learns a lot in the educational talks that are always offered. She will use the 2,000 soles she is requesting to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers to be able to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
El sr. Edwin Vásquez se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de achinería de manera ambulante en la Terminal de transportes de la ciudad de Danli, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace tres años. 
El vende una gran variedad de productos los que adquiere en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, ya que viaja una vez por semana para la compra de mercadería.
Edwin es una persona que se ha sabido ganar a sus clientes por la amabilidad con que los atiende, también se dedica a la venta de artículos para la cocina como ser juegos de ollas, los cuales vende en diferentes partes de esta ciudad y estos productos los vende al crédito por lo que deja un día a la semana para recuperar dichos pagos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar auticulos varios y ollas.
Don Edwin Vásquez es casado,  su esposa es ama de casa, producto del matrimonio ellos tienen tres hijos los que dependen económicamente de ellos.
actualmente sus hijos están cursando sus estudios primarios.
texts.en:
For the past three years, Edwin Vásquez has been a traveling salesman dedicated to selling small goods in the transportation terminal in the city of Danli. He sells a wide variety of products that he gets from the city of Tegucigalpa and travels once a week to buy the merchandise. Edwin is a man who has known how to gain clients through the friendliness with which he attends to them. He also sells products for the kitchen, such as cookware, which he sells in different parts of the city. He sells these products on credit, so he leaves one day a week to claim these payments. He will use this credit to buy various goods and cookware to sell. Edwin is married, and his wife is a housewife. They have three children in elementary school that depend on them economically.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flashlights, batteries, carts, pots, combs, toothpaste, brushes, and toys

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario, de 53 años, esta casado con Enedina, ambos tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Pian. Él es albañil y todos los días trabaja para poder ayudar en los gastos diarios de la familia; mientras que su esposa Enedina se dedica a la ganadería, pero el momento más importante para ellos es cuando se encuentran en el campo, donde siembran espinaca y gladiolos desde hace ya 40 años.  Viajar a la capital de su país para vender sus productos es lo que más le gusta a Hilario, ya que puede comprar muchas cosas que no encuentra en su pueblo, es por ello que piensa poner una tienda de abarrotes, cuando aumente su capital de trabajo. Es su octavo crédito con MFP y le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque puede ayudar a las personas que necesiten capital para poder producir. Con el crédito que solicita comprará semillas y abono para los gladiolos que cultivará.
texts.en:
Hilario, age 53, is married to Enedina. They have five minor children. They live together in their own house, which is located in the Pian community. He is a bricklayer, and he works everyday to be able to help with the family’s daily expenses. His wife, Enedina, works with the livestock. However, the most important time for them is when they are in the field planting spinach and gladioli, which they have been doing for 40 years. Traveling to the capital of the country to sell his products is what Hilario likes the best. He likes it because he is able to buy a lot of things that are not found in his town. That is why he is planning to establish a grocery store when he has more working capital. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He likes working with his communal bank because it can help the people who need capital to be able to produce. He will use the requested loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the gladioli that he will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gladiolus seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Isata, who is a married mother of two children, aged six and ten years, and has one additional dependent living with her, her nephew, who she is helping to educate. In 2007, Isata established her ready-made items business to help support her husband provide for the needs of their family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 800,000SLL every month from this business.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000SLL. in order to add more stock to her business. Isata hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000SLL. In the future, she plans to educate her children to university and buy a piece of land. Isata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos es padre de familia de tres hijos, casado, su esposa tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortilla lo que es de gran ayuda para la familia.
Hoy en día don Carlos trabaja como guarda de seguridad, para lograr un sueldo fijo. Su negocio durante todo este tiempo ha sido de soldador, albañil, lo que muy poco estaba trabajando y no captaba el dinero necesario para sus gastos alimenticios de la familia.
Lo que comienza a buscar trabajo, para cubrir esta necesidad. Lo que está siendo ahora es que como trabaja veinticuatro horas y luego tiene un día libre hace sus pequeños trabajo de soldadura y así poder equilibrarse ya que todo está  a costos altos.
Afodenic ha sido una fuente de apoyo que ayudado a  mejorar el nivel de vida en su pequeño negocio de soldadura como en vivienda. Con este préstamo hará un muro frontal y lograr mejor seguridad y privacidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is the father of a family with three children. He is married and his wife has a small business selling tortillas, which is a great help to the family. In order to earn a steady income, Carlos currently works as a security guard. His business has always been as a welder and bricklayer, but he was not working very much and not bringing in enough money to cover the family's food expenses. He started to look for other work so he could cover this expense. Now he works for 24 hours and then he has one day off, which is when he does his small welding jobs. In this way, he is able to balance things, as expenses are very high. AFODENIC has been a source of support that has helped him to improve his quality of life, his small welding business, and his home. With this loan, he will construct a front wall so that his family will have better security and privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a wall to improve the security and privacy of his family's house

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario Q. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de la Compañía en la ciudad de Cuenca. Esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener aun su cultura y tradiciones, tiene su centro histórico que fue nombrado el 1 de diciembre  1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora Rosario tiene 70 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad  que viven de manera independiente con sus familias. Doña Rosario vive con su nieto quien trabaja. Su esposo es jubilado y con el trabajo de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar, también  cría cerdos, vacas, gallinas, cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en su propio sector.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y medio y los créditos le han ayudado para  comprar animales para incrementar su negocio. Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Tiene una muy buena amistad con las socias de la banca comunal ya que son mujeres luchadoras que busca  un mejor porvenir.
 
Su sueño es  seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosario Q. is a member of the "Damas Responsables" ["Responsible Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Compañía area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for maintaining its culture and traditions, and its historic center was named a World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. Ms. Rosario is 70 years old, married, and has six children who live independently with their own families. She lives with her grandson, who works. Her husband is retired and thanks to both of their work, they were able to build their own house. Ms. Rosario dedicates herself to household chores and she also raises pigs, cows, hens, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her area. She has been a member of her communal bank for six and a half years and the loans have helped her to buy animals to increase her business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs and feed for her animals. She has a good friendship with the other members of her communal bank, as they are all spirited women looking for a better future. Her dream is to continue keeping up her health.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her animals

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina se dedica a una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Pues siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Realiza sus compras de contado en Managua y a camiones repartidores, ella compra la mayoría de sus productos en el mercado ya que los precios son más baratos y le generan más ingresos, sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, para la compra de golosinas, refrescos y jugos  el cual está generando ingresos favorables, la señora vive de manera moderada  y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Argentina runs a pulpería [a small grocery store] out of her house. She is always looking for ways to generate more income for her family. She makes her purchases with cash in Managua and from distribution trucks. She buys most of her products at the market, as the prices are the lowest there, which creates the most profits. She makes her sales by cash and on credit. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business, in order to buy candy, soft drinks, and juices, as these items are generating good profits. This woman lives in moderation, with all of the basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Isheka

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isheka, a married father of three children aged 4, 6 and 13 years respectively. He has one additional dependent living with him that he is helping to educate. A very hard working man, in 2005 Isheka established his used clothing business, an enterprise he is determined to keep profitable. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le800000 every month from this business.

Isheka is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000SLL. in order to buy more stock, hoping to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000SLL. In the future, Isheka plans to expand his business, build a house for his family, and continue to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Celia María

texts.es:
La Señora Celia María C. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de Visorrey en la ciudad de Cuenca. Esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener aun su cultura y tradiciones, tiene su centro histórico que fue nombrado el 1 de diciembre  1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Doña Celia tiene 70 años, es casada y tiene 11 hijos mayores de edad, siete de ellos son casados y viven en su casa compartiendo gastos, sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan y también aportan para la economía del hogar. Su esposo es jubilado y pasa en la casa, la casa en la que viven es propia y lo han construido con el trabajo de los dos.

La Señora Celia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar en donde cría cuyes,pollos y cerdos a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y hortalizas que los utilizan para el consumo de su  numerosa familia. A sus pollos los vende en las ferias de la ciudad.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 6 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado para su negocio, el nuevo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal lo va  a invertir en la compra  de pollos.
 
Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio y mantener su salud.
texts.en:
Celia María C. is a member of the communal bank Damas Responsables (Responsible Women) and lives in the Visorrey area of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for maintaining its own culture and traditions, and its historical center was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. Celia is 70 years old, married, and has 11 adult children, seven of whom are married and live in her house sharing the costs. Her four unmarried children work and also contribute to the household finances. Her husband is retired and spends his time in the house, which they own and built together. Celia does the household chores in their home, in which she raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs that she sells when she has the need. She is also involved in farming, sowing corn and vegetables which are used to feed her large family. She sells the chickens in the city markets. She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and all of the loans have benefitted her business. The new loan she is taking through the communal bank will be used to buy chickens. Her goal is to continue growing her business and maintain her health.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene un negocio que es una pequeña panadería ubicada en su casa de habitación, entrega su producto a diversas pulperías y sus comarcas todos los días de lunes a domingo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido muy importante para ella. El señor Oscar vive junto a su esposa la cual ayuda con el negocio, ya que cuando el sale a entregar ella vende el producto en su casa. Está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio como leña, harina huevos, mantequilla entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar's business is a small bakery located in his house. He delivers his products to various pulperías [small grocery stores] in his district every day of the week. This is not the first time that he is requesting a loan, and previous ones have been very important for him. Oscar lives with his wife, who helps him with the business. When he is out delivering bread she sells it from their house. He is requesting a new loan to buy staples like firewood, flour, eggs, butter, and other necessary items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood, flour, eggs, butter, and other necessary staples for baking

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 66 años, vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijas, Edith de 38 y Gisela de 20 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Pian. Todos los días sale temprano a trabajar como albañil y por las tardes ayuda a su esposa en casa,  ya que Gisela su hija menor no puede caminar producto de un accidente, sin embargo se da tiempo para poder sembrar flores en su chacra.  A él le gusta trabajar en el campo, “es el único momento que puedo estar con toda mi familia”, asegura. Por otro lado tiene que viajar constantemente a la capital, por que es ahí donde vende las flores que siembra, ya tiene 46 años dedicándose a esta actividad y con el tiempo desea construir una mejor casa para que su familia pueda vivir cómodamente. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y ya conoce todas las actividades y la forma de trabajo de su banco comunal, eso le entusiasma mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y fertilizantes para las flores que sembrará en estos meses.
texts.en:
Juan, age 66, lives with his wife and their two daughters. Edith is 38, and Gisela is 20. They live in their own house, which is located in the town of Pian. He leaves early everyday to work as a bricklayer. In the afternoons he helps his wife at home. His youngest daughter, Gisela, is not able to walk due to an accident. Nevertheless, it gives him time to be able to plant flowers on his farm. He likes working in the field. “It is the only time that I am able to be with my whole family,” he says. On the other hand, he has to constantly travel to the capital because that is where he sells the flowers that he grows. He has been doing this work for 46 years. In time he wishes to build a better house for his family to be able to live comfortably. This is his third loan with MFP. He knows all of the activities and the way to work with his communal bank, which fills him with much enthusiasm. He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy seeds and fertilizer for the flowers that he grows during these months.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tommy

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Tommy. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 13 years. He has one additional dependant who lives with him because they need help with their education. In 2004, Tommy established a business selling ready-to-wear items such as shoes and clothes. He began his business to help him generate income to support his family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. Tommy would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more stock and make more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Tommy plans to open a shop and start an internal business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: America es una señora D. 61 años D. edad, es casada y vive en la zona A D. Huaycan, además tiene 3 hijos y aun esta a cargo D. uno, comenzó siendo ama D. casa y desD. hace 6 años que trabaja con Edaprospo, hoy en día también cubre los gastos D. su casa y el mantenimiento del auto que utiliza su esposo para ganar dinero haciendo transporte interprovincial D. manera independiente,  no obstante desea pronto comprar una casa y un auto para hacer taxi. America ah sido elegida, en esta ultima oportunidad, como presidenta D. su grupo llamado “Las Azucenas” el cual lleva 6 años D. haberse formado y conformado por sus amigas y vecinas que también comparten el gusto por esta flor ya que se utiliza para la primera comunión como símbolo D. pureza y belleza.
texts.en:
America is a woman who is 61 years old. She is married and lives in the A zone in Huaycan. Additionally, she has three children and she is still in charge of one of them. She began being a housewife and has been working with Edaprospo for six years. Today, she covers her housing expenses and maintenance for the car her husband uses to earn money as an independent, interprovincial transportation provider. Nevertheless, she wishes to soon buy a house and a car, which she'd make a taxi. America has been elected, in this last opportunity, to be the president of a group called "Las Azucenas" (the Lilies), which has been together for six years and is maD. up of friends and neighbors who also share the love of the flower since it is used in first communion as a symbol of purity and beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and ingredients.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor EMILIO G. F.  tiene 45 años, vive en la Zona del Plan 3000 calle 7 Av. principal. Tiene dos hijos dependientes de el, el tiene un taller de cerrajería en su mismo domicilio. 

Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a esta profesión pero como es un trabajador independiente no tiene seguro contra accidentes y infortunadamente tuvo un accidente laboral y por este motivo necesita el préstamo para poder pagar los gastos curativos de su empleado. Por lo que el cliente requiere del dinero para esta emergencia. 

El Sr. Emilio es un cliente antiguo del CIDRE, es muy buen cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio G. F. is 45 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 zone, 7th Street, Main Avenue. He has two children who are dependent on him and he runs a locksmith shop from his home. He has been dedicated to this profession for 20 years, but since he is an independent worker, he does not have accident insurance. Unfortunately, there was a work-related accident and he needs this loan to pay for his employee's medical expenses. He needs to borrow money for this emergency. Mr. Emilio is an old client of CIDRE, and he is a very good client.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for his employee

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 31 años, convive con Pedro de 31 años, ambos tuvieron 4 hijos menores a los cuales alimenta y educa en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Duraznillo. Como es de costumbre todas las mañanas sale a la ciudad a vender los gladiolos que ella misma siembra en un terreno alquilado; ya hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, y ahora desea tener mayor capital para poder vender en varios puntos del país. Olga disfruta de su trabajo porque puede salir a varios lugares y no tiene que regatear sus flores ya que ella misma las vende de lugar en lugar. Pero en estos meses tiene planes de viajar a la capital para vender las flores que sembrará con el préstamo que obtenga. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y esta contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal donde puede progresar y salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Olga, 31 years old, lives with Pedro who is also 31. Together they have 4 minor children they provide for and educate in their own house, located in the village of Duraznillo. As is customary, every morning Olga goes out into the city to sell gladiolas that she grew on rented land. For 10 years she has been dedicated to agriculture, and now she wants to have more capital in order to sell in various parts of the country. Olga likes her work because she can travel to various places and doesn't have to bargain to sell flowers, because now she herself does the selling from place to place. During these months, she has plans to travel to the capital to sell flowers that she will sow with this loan. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is content to belong to a communal bank where she can progress and get ahead. With this loan she will buy seeds and manure for her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GLADIOLA SEEDS AND MANURE

loans.name: Julio Lauro

texts.es:
Julio de 37 años, el es vendedor informal de productos y artículos en las calles de Guayaquil, vive en la parte del suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Desde pequeño el comenzó a trabajar como comerciante informal para tener su propio dinero y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, ahora el trabaja con otras personas como grupos de vendedores de artículos electrónicos y productos. Trabaja todos los días incluso en feriados para poder mantener a su esposa e hija de 11 años. 

Para seguir vendiendo el quiere comprar con el préstamo juguetes, lámparas y paraguas para sus ventas, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener mas clientes para darle una mejor vida a familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 37 years old and is an informal salesman of various items in the streets of Guayaquil. He lives in part of the suburbs of Guayaquil. Since he was young, he started to work as an informal salesman in order to have his own money and to help his parents with their family's expenses. Now he works with other people, as a group of merchants selling electronic items and other products. He works every day, including holidays, in order to provide for his wife and 11 year-old daughter. In order to continue making sales, he wants to use this loan to buy toys, lamps, and umbrellas to sell. In the future, he would like to build his house better and to have more customers, in order to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toys, lamps, and umbrellas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic materials and supplies for shoemaking, such as imitation leather, and especially jeans fabric (denim)

loans.name: Victorino Asuncion

texts.es: Victorino tiene 59 años vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar como es la venta de mercadería en general,  le gusta mucho su trabajo, con el paso del tiempo ha podido ampliar su clientela  que le solicitan diferentes productos, en sus metas para el futuro tiene planeado instalar establecer su negocio en su vivienda, por lo que el sale todos los días en su bicicleta. Victorino tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa y otras cosas de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Victorino is 59 years old, he lives with his wife and their 2 young children, who are economically dependent on him. He started engaging in retail when he was very young, he likes his job very much and in time the number of his customers has increased, and they ask for different products. His future plans include establishing a shop in his house, as he now works every day with his bicycle. Victorino plans to use the loan he is requesting to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes and other items in order to succeed in his job.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Helen Silvia

texts.es:
La señora HELEN SILVIA A. O. de 26 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años, ella vive en el Barrio Villa Bolivia de la Zona del Plan 3000.

Ella tiene su propio restaurante, hace comida todos los días para poder subsistir, cocinando diferentes platos diariamente.

Necesita el dinero para poder aumentar su cantidad de Platos que elabora por día y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y asi mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
HELEN SILVIA A. O. is 26 years old. She is single and has a 4 year old son. She lives in the Villa Bolivia neighborhood of the Plan 3000 area. She has her own restaurant. She makes food every say to get by, cooking different dishes daily. He needs the money to be able to increase thw number of dishes that she makes every day and thus improve her income and improve her and her son's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza tiene 25 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, un distrito situado cerca al mar que tiene como actividades principales a la pesca y al comercio. Pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a dos horas de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de F. en el exterior del mercado de la ciudad de Pacasmayo, ella realiza esta actividad todos los dias y ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro. Sus clientes prefieren su negocio debido a la calidad de trato y a la variedad de F. que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio los utiliza para apoyar a su familia con su economia diaria.

María desea implementar su negocio con la compra de mas F., de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor numero de ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de soicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer respnsable y bastante entregada a su trabajo. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y aprecio. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is 25 years old. She lives with her family in the Pacasmayo district, a district located close to the ocean, whose main activies are fishing and trade. It belongs to the province of the same name and is in the La Libertad region. It is approximately two hours from the city Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells flowers outside the Pacasmayo city market. She does this activity every day and has several years experience in this area. Her customers prefer her business due to the quality of service and the variety of flowers she offers. She uses the income she receives from this business to support her family's daily expenses. Maria wants to outfit her business by purchasing more flowers so that she can increase her sales and earn more profit. To acheive her goal, it has been necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. She is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her job. In the area where she lives, people know her and esteem and appreciate her. She has already had loans with Edpyme Alternativa previously and she has shown herself to be punctual and responsible when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flowers to grow her business in the market.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es una mujer emprendedora de 40 años, está casada con Marino de 40 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven solo con dos de ellos, Fiorela de 9 y Medaly de 3 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Pian. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de menestras y máchica, desde entonces sale a vender todos los días estos productos en su tienda, ubicada en el centro del pueblo. Le gusta su trabajo porque le parece muy rentable, es por eso que decidió hace un año llevar sus productos a la capital de su país para poder vender; como mujer ambiciosa Judith también cultiva cebada con su esposo, posteriormente piensa incrementar su capital para poder aumentar sus ganancias y de esa manera brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijas. Este es el décimo cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, y le agradece mucho el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería, semillas y abono para poder sembrar.
texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking woman who is 40 years old. She is married to Marino, who is also 40, and the two of them have 5 children, though only 2 of their children currently live with them: 9-year-old Fiorela and 3-year-old Medaly. They live in their own house, which is located in the town of Pian. For 3 years Judith has made a living selling vegetable stew and máchica (toasted barley flour). Every day she goes out to sell these products in her shop, which is located in the center of the town. She enjoys her work because it seems very profitable, and that is why she decided a year ago to transport her products to her country’s capital so that she could sell them there. Being an ambitious woman, Judith also grows barley with her husband, and thinks that by increasing her capital she will be able to increase her profits and thus provide a better life for their daughters. This is Judith’s tenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she greatly appreciates the support that her communal bank provides. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase merchandise, seeds, and fertilizer so that she can plant her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 54 tiene 3 hijos. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que Rosa siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia, desde muy joven ha trabajado, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio tiene una gran variedad de clientes pues ha sido muy provechoso. Este financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, trajes, cosméticos y calzado. Sueña con establecer un tramo en el mercado para mostrar sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 54 years old and has 3 children. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. Rosa is always looking for a way to improve her income so she can support her family; she has worked since she was very young, and it has not been easy to maintain her business. She has had her business for more than 6 years, and it has been very profitable because she has a large variety of customers. She will use this loan to purchase pants, shirts, dresses, cosmetics, and shoes. Rosa dreams of setting up a stall in the market so that she can display her various products.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing clothing.

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: UNA LUZ AL DESARROLLO

Eloyda tiene 29 años de edad es casada y tiene  dos hijos menores, lleva tiempo participando del programa prosperidad- Edaprospo, hace dos años Eloyda participa en la Alcancía Comunal, “Una luz al Desarrollo”
 Se dedica a trabajar  vendiendo prendas de vestir sobre pedidos, este negocio lo viene realizando casi 2 años y fue una de susu primas quien le incentivo a trabajar, con el tiempo ella ha ido ganando más clientes, por lo cual se han incrementado tanto su capital y sus ganancias han ido aumentando, asimismo Eloyda se preparo en cursos de Chocolatería Fina, en la que fue capacitándose y ahora se dedica a la preparación de chocotejas, bombones, toffees, y otras variedades de productos para acontecimientos especiales, 
Por el esfuerzo puesto Eloyda ha logrado comprar un terreno para vivienda, en una zona donde cuenta con los servicios básicos: luz y agua,. Ya que anteriormente ella no contaba con estos servicios y se le hacia difícil poder habituarse, asimismo ella cuenta con un pequeño ahorro que se dispondrá para los estudios y la salud de sus hijos mas adelante, las ganancias que ella obtiene a diario lo utiliza para los gastos del día, y para invertir en su negocio.
 Ella sueña obtener un capital para comprar o alquilar un puesto de negocio para ubicar un bazar de prendas de vestir y venta de regalos.
El crédito que ella adquirió por EDAPROSPO, lo invertirá en  la compra de mercaderías para su negocio.
texts.en:
A LIGHT TOWARDS DEVELOPMENT COMMUNAL BANK Eloyda, 29, is married and has two minor children. She has been participating in the Prosperidad-Edaprospo program for some time; she’s been a member of the A Light Towards Development Communal Bank for two years. She sells clothing on order. She has been in this line of work for almost 2 years. One of her cousins encouraged her to work. As time has passed she has gained more customers so both her capital and profits have increased. Similarly, Eloyda took courses in Fine Chocolate work and is now able to make chocotejas (chocolate fondant covered candies), bonbons, toffees and other varieties of items for special events. Thanks to her efforts, Eloyda has been able to buy a house. It is in a zone that has all basic utilities: electricity and water. Previously she did not have these utilities and it was difficult to live that way. She also has some savings that is designated for her children’s health and future education costs. Profits she earns are for daily expenses and to invest in her business. She dreams with having capital to buy or rent a place to set up her clothing and gift shop. The loan she got from EDAPROSPO will be used to buy merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING AUTO PARTS FOR HIS REPAIR SHOP AND PAINT AND CEMENT FOR HIS BEDROOM

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego, de 18 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus 3 hermanos, que son mayores y trabajan, todos en unión habitan en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 2 años, este trabajador joven se dedica a la venta de bolsas, al por mayor, y ya tiene clientes fijos a los que ofrece su mercadería. Pero dice que la mayoría de sus clientes  se encuentran en un gran emporio comercial al que se dirige todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana y su labor  termina cuando ya no tiene mercadería que es el promediar las 4 de la tarde. Aunque afirma que el trabajo de ambulante es algo cansado, su esfuerzo se recompensa con las regulares ganancias que percibe de las ventas diarias. Como es emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de todo tipo de bolsas en algún mercado de la zona por donde vive; además también quiere estudiar una carrera técnica y de esta manera asegurar su futuro. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente en agradecimiento a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Diego tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en bolsas pues quiere abastecer mejor a sus clientes y calcula que sus ganancias aumentaran.
texts.en:
Diego, age 18, lives with his parents and his three siblings in his parents’ house. His siblings are adults, and they work. They live together in a populous neighborhood to the north of the city. For two years this hard-working young man has been selling bags wholesale. He offers his merchandise to the fixed customers that he has. Most of his customers can be found at a large commercial market where he goes everyday at eight in the morning. He finishes working when he no longer has merchandise, which is, on the average, at four in the afternoon. Even though he admits that working in an itinerant manner is tiring, his efforts are rewarded with the regular income that he gets from the daily sales. As an entrepreneur, in the future he plans to establish a store that sells all types of bags. He will do this in some market in the area where he lives. Also, he wants to study for a technical career in order to ensure his future. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make his payments on time in appreciation to all of the people who make it possible. The money will allow him to keep working in the search for progress. Diego plans to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of bags. He wants to better stock his customers, and he calculates that his earnings will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on a greater quantity of bags to ensure his sales

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es: Williams Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y que está muy contento con medio de vida. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de carpintería, pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El inicio hace mas de 12 años lo aprendió por medio de su amigo, con el paso del tiempo es que decide establecer su propio medio de ingreso y así ayudar con los gastos del hogar pues siempre sus clientes le solicitan diferentes pedidos. El solicita este crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, pega, tornillos y herramientas que son necesarias para realizar sillas, camas, escritorio, mesas y cunas.
texts.en:
Williams Antonio is a very hard-working man, and he is very happy with his line of work. He is a carpenter, and he devotes himself to his customers’ requests. He started over 12 years ago, and he learned from his friend. As time passed, he decided to establish his own means of income to help with the household expenses. His customers always make different requests. He is asking for this loan to buy wood, nails, glue, screws, and the necessary tools to make chairs, beds, desks, tables, and cribs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan de 51 años, vende periódicos en las calles de Guayaquil con su bicicleta, vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada y muchas casas de caña a su alrededor. 

Ya tiene 20 años vendiendo periódicos por la falta de oportunidades y la necesidad dinero. Su esposa le ayuda con algunos gastos vendiendo libros ellos tiene 4 hijos que en ocasiones su hijo menor le ayuda a vender los periódicos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. 

Para ayudarle a sus hijos con sus estudios el quiere comprar con el préstamo libros y cuadernos y un aparte dirigirla para pagar las pensiones. En el futuro quiere tener un vehiculo para ya no recorrer en bicicleta.
texts.en:
Juan, age 51, sells newspapers with his bicycle on the streets of Guayaquil. He lives a periurban area called the Perimetral. It is situated near a salt marsh with lots of cane houses around it. He has been selling newspapers for 20 years due to the lack of opportunities and the need to make money. His wife helps him with some of the expenses by selling books. They have four children. Sometimes their oldest child helps him sell the newspapers. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. everyday. In order to help his children with their education, he wants to use the loan to buy books and notebooks. He will use some of the loan to pay the school fees. In the future he wants to have a vehicle so that he no longer has to use his bicycle when he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Books and notebooks

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas se encuentra formado por 8 mujeres  y 2 hombres, quienes luchan para sacar adelante a sus familias con su trabajo diario. Viven por diferentes sectores de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de la población joven sale a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.  

La Señora María Andrea M. se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Vive en la comunidad del Despacho que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Doña María tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos que son mayores de edad, casados y viven  independientemente. Su esposo se dedica  al trabajo en la agricultura. Tiene casa propia la misma que  han construido con el trabajo conyugal en su juventud.
La Señora María se dedica a su negocio, tiene un kiosco donde vende variedad de productos, el mismo que lo tiene hace 6 meses y  trabaja en el los días sábados y domingos, los demás  días de la semana se dedica a la cría de animales como aves de corral  y chanchos a  los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de galletas, gaseosas, chupetes, cigarrillos, etc.  para incrementar su kiosco.
 
su meta es crecer en su negocio.

La Señora María Felicia S. vive en la comunidad de Maluay que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Tiene de 40 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de  23, 20, 17, 15, 14, 12, y 2 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo son casados y viven de manera independiente su segundo hijo es quien trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de la casa, sus hijos de 15 y 14 años no estudian pero le ayudan en los quehaceres domésticos, su hijo de 12 años estudia en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo es albañil y con su trabajo saca adelante a su familia.  Con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María se dedica hace 6 meses a trabajar como empleada domestica,  labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 a.m. hasta la 1 p.m., el resto de su tiempo se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos, espera que los créditos le ayuden para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es de superarse junto  a su  familia.
texts.en:
The Las Minas community bank is composed of 8 women and 2 men, who fight in their daily work to get their families ahead. They live in different sectors of the Valle parish. This parish is characterized by its population's work in agriculture and the raising of animals.
