Much of the young population leaves the city to work in different areas; also, many have migrated in search of better work. This is María Andrea M.'s first loan with the Fundación. She lives in the Despacho community which belongs to the Valle parish. Maria is 62, married and has 6 children who are grown, married and live on their own. Her husband works in agriculture. She has her own home which she and her husband built together in their youth. Maria has a kiosk where she sells a variety of products. She has had it for 6 months and works Saturdays and Sundays. The rest of the days of the week, she raises animals such as barnyard birds and pigs, which she sells when she has any economic need. She will invest her loan in the purchase of cookies, pop, lollipops, cigarettes, etc. in order to stock her kiosk. Her goal is to expand her business. María Felicia S. lives in the Maluay community which belongs to the Valle parish. She is 40, married and has 7 children ages 23, 20, 17, 15, 14, 12, and 2. Her oldest and third children are married and live independently. Her second child works and helps her with the household costs. Her 15 and 14 year old children aren't in school but help her with the housework. Her 12-year-old child goes to a school in the community. Her husband is a bricklayer and he gets his family ahead with his work. With Maria and her husband's work, they were able to build their own home. For 6 months, Maria has worked as a maid. She works Monday to Friday from 8 am. to 1 pm. The rest of her time is spent raising chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community. This is her first loan in the community bank and she will invest it in the purchase of hogs and chickens. She hopes that the loans will help her to expand her business. Her goal is to improve herself with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cookies, pop, lollipops, cigarettes, etc.  / pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, ella ayuda con la economía del hogar, Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo pocos productos como ropa y calzado pero como necesitaba más dinero para tener su negocio, comenzó a realzar financiamientos para ofrecer una gran variedad.  Ahora trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días.  El destino del crédito es para comprar pantalones, ropa interior, cosméticos, toallas y sabanas. Es muy conocida por la cuadra y tiene mucha clientela, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
51-year old Maria del Carmen sells general merchandise. Her income helps to support the household. She started out selling a few products like clothing and footwear, but as she needed more money, she obtained loans to stock her store with a greater variety of goods. Maria works from 7am to 8pm every day. She plans to use this loan to buy pants, underwear, cosmetics, towels, and sheets. Well-known in the neighbourhood and with many customers, Maria is responsible and hardworking. She is very grateful to the institution and the support that she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo. Pues no es el primer crédito que solicita ya que tiene cierta experiencia para mejorar su negocio. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que le gusta luchar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, pues su negocio ha crecido con el paso del tiempo. Este crédito es para  mejorar su negocio y comprar cerdos. Ella sueña con obtener una pulpería, ya que así ganaría más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maria del Socorro earns her living by selling pork. As this isn’t her first loan, she has some experience using money to improve her business. She has always been an enterprising woman so she enjoys the daily struggle and helping her children make their way in the world. Her business has grown over the years. Maria will use this loan to improve her business and buy pigs. Her dream is to own a grocery store as this would provide a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lediz Mercedes

texts.es:
Lediz Mercedes O. es la propietaria de un restaurante llamado Restaurante la Guajira, que está ubicado en el municipio de Santo Tomás en el departamento del Atlántico; ella es una mujer que tiene un hijo  y con este negocio ha logrado sacarlo adelante, aunque ya   tiene 40 años de edad y es autosuficiente. En la actualidad está solicitando su credikiva para darle un mejor acabado a su mueblería del  restaurante y   también comprar por bultos materias primas   para preparar sus alimentos como el arroz y el aceite. Lediz desde hace treinta años tiene este negocio y lo conoce perfectamente, aunque inició con la venta de fritangueria y fue agregándole poco a poco comida corriente, sopa etc. hasta lograr organizarlo como lo tiene en este momento: un restaurante muy prospero, donde también vende comidas especiales y corrientes.
Su meta principal es separar el negocio de su habitación y mejorar las condiciones locativas del mismo. Su principal desafío el la falta de capital porque le  resultan costosos los créditos y las oportunidades de tenerlos, razón por la cual está recurriendo a    la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que planea inyectar capital de trabajo constante a su negocio y hacerlo cada día mas exitoso..
texts.en:
Lediz Mercedes O. owns a restaurant called La Guajira located in the municipality of Santo Tomás in the department Atlántico. She has a son, and her business has helped him get ahead in life even though he is already 40 years old and independent. Lediz is now seeking a Kiva loan to better furnish her restaurant, and also to buy ingredients like rice and oil in bulk for the food she makes. She has run her restaurant for thirty years and knows the business inside out. She started out running a ‘fritangueria’ (traditional restaurant) and gradually added fast food, soups etc until she got to the stage she is at today: running a very prosperous restaurant where she sells all kinds of dishes. Lediz’s principal goal is to separate the business from the house and thus improve them both. Her main challenge is the lack of capital--getting a loan is costly and difficult to obtain. For this reason she is approaching Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organisation which will provide working capital so she can make her business more successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to better furnish her restaurant, and also to buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, de 42 años, vive al lado de su esposo Dilmer de 43 años y de sus 4 hijos mayores que trabajan y se mantienen, además para lograr salir adelante todos se esfuerzan a diario. Esta trabajadora mujer empezó a dedicarse al comercio de muy joven y desde hace 15 años,  se dedica a la venta de toda variedad de bolsas, junto a sus hijos, quienes también son grandes vendedores. Tres veces a la semana, se dirige a un gran emporio comercial de su ciudad y comercializa en ese lugar sus bolsas, algunas veces lo realiza sola, y otras veces con sus hijos. Y esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas, además que el trabajo es tranquilo, lo que le permite seguir con sus labores del hogar sin problemas. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, por lo que desea instalar una tienda  de venta de ropa, en algún centro comercial de la zona por donde vive. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Felipa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en bolsas, pues quiere surtirse mejor para ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felipa, 42, lives with her husband, Dilmer, 43, and with her four adult children who work and support themselves. Everyone works hard daily to get ahead. This hard working woman started out in business very young and for the last 15 years has been selling all kinds of bags alongside her children who are great sellers. Three times a week she goes to a large shopping center in her city to sell her bags there. Sometimes she does this by herself and sometimes with her children. She is very satisfied because she earns good profits from the sales. Besides, it is calm work which allows her to continue with her household chores problem-free. Since she is an enterprising woman her future plans include expanding the business. She wants to set up a clothing store in some shopping center near her home. This is her 6th loan from MFP and she promises to repay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint all the people who funded the loan that will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Felipa plans to use the money to buy a larger amount of bags so that she can be better stocked for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on bags.

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: Johanna tiene 40 años su actividad es una pulpería y también la venta de recargas telefónica. Ella es una persona muy responsable lo ha demostrado pagando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido muy importantes.  El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar su negocio para ofréceles a sus clientes sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Johanna, 40, has a grocery store and also sells cards loaded with phone call minutes. She is a person who has demonstrated responsibility by making her payments on time and in full. This is not the first time that she has taken a loan, and these loans have been very important to her. This loan is to buy merchandise such as snacks, soft drinks, juices, detergents and staple grains. She dreams of improving her income and expanding her business so that she can offer her customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy snacks, soft drinks, detergents and staple grains for her store

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Las Monicas, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola dedicado especificamente al cultivo de frutas las cuales son procesadas para exportarlas a diversos paises del exterior. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura y pertenece a la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital se la región Lambayeque.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, el anhelo de sacarlos adelante hizo que empezara hace algunos años un negocio de venta de comida en un puesto situado en el sector Malingas, ubicado a diez minutos de la zona. Ella se dirige todos los dias a este lugar a ofrecer los diversos platos que prepara con buena sazón, su negocio cuenta conmuy buena acogida y gracias a el apoya a su esposo con sus gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente cuenta con una bodega – tienda instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario. Ella desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer tranquila y responsable, las personas que la conocen la consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que le necesitan.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar, 33, is married and has 2 children. She lives with her family in the Las Monicas neighborhood, a rural area in the Tambogrande district, which is an agricultural district that specializes in the cultivation of fruit that is then processed and exported abroad to various countries. The area where she lives is located in the Piura province, and belongs to the region of the same name, and is located more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her desire to provide for them led her to start a business selling food some years ago in a stall located in the Malingas neighborhood, which is 10 minutes from her neighborhood. Here she manages every day to offer a variety of delicious dishes that she prepares. Her business is well-received by the public, and with this business she able to help her husband with the household expenses. In addition, she has a small store set up in her house, where she offers her neighbors all types of everyday consumer products. She wants to expand her store with the purchase of more products so that she can increase her sales and earn more. To do this, she is requesting, for the first time, a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Maria is a calm and responsible person. The people who know her consider her to be trustworthy and always ready to help those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products that are basic necessities and groceries to expand the store that she runs out of her house

loans.name: Enocracia

texts.en:
Enocracia V. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Enocracia owns and operates a business operating boat-ride services. Enocracia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Enocracia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. Enocracia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a new engine. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat engine

loans.name: Mely Daisy

texts.en:
Mely Daisy N. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mely Daisy owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Mely Daisy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Mely Daisy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Mely Daisy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Norbasa

texts.en:
Norbasa G. is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Norbasa owns and operates a business venture operating pedicab transport services. Norbasa has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Norbasa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for his business. Norbasa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fish and shrimp in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Janet joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Janet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn R. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a clothing business. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Merlyn joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el Caserío Enmanuel, una zona agrícola perteneciente al distrito de Las Lomas de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maracuyá, el cuenta con varias plantas que brindan este fruto, el cual es cosaechado dos veces por año. Las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que preparan el producto para exportarlo a diversos países del extranjero. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Con el dinero que le brindan estas actividades el solventa la economia de su familia.

Angel deseabrindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maracuyá para asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. El es una persona responsable y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Angel, age 39, lives with his wife and four children. They live in the Enmanuel rural community, which is an agricultural area in the Las Lomas district, Piura province. It is located in the region of the same name, and it is over three hours to the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He mainly grows passion fruit, and he has various plants that produce this fruit. The fruit is harvested two times a year. He sells the fruit he harvests to processing plants to prepare to export to different foreign countries. He also raises cows. The money from these activities supports the family’s expenses. Angel wishes to provide his passion fruit crops with maintenance to ensure a good harvest. In order to achieve this objective he has seen the need, for the first time, to request a loan for 1,000 soles from the Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. His greatest desire is to see his children become professionals. He is a responsible person, and he is devoted to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to provide maintenance to his crop of passion fruit

loans.name: Ricardo Esteban

texts.es:
Ricardo es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Cuenta con un vehículo que utiliza brindando servicio de transporte escolar, el cuenta con un grupo fijo de escolares que utilizan el servicio durante la mañana y por la tarde. Este negocio constituye su unica fuente de ingreso y debido al uso constante el vehículo necesita siempre de mantenimiento permanente.

Precisamente por este motivo es que el está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en los gastos que tenga que realizar para brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo y así poder seguir brindando sustento a su familia, garantizando la seguridad de los menores que suele transportar. El es consciente de la responsabilidad que conlleva el trabajar en el transporte de menores de edad, los padres de los niños confían mucho en él.

Ricardo ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y con el fondo Kiva, durante su primer préstamo pagó sus cuotas puntualmente y pudo garantizar el buen funcionamiento de su vehículo. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus tres hijos convertidos en profesionales y tener la satisfacción de haberles brindado un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 47 year old father. He lives with his wife and three children in his parent's house in the city of Chiclayo. He has a vehicle that he uses to run a school transport service. He has a steady group of students that use his service in the morning and afternoon. This business is his only source of income and due to the constant use of the vehicle, it is always in need of maintenance. It is precisely for this reason that he is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the loan to cover the expenses of maintaining his vehicle. This will allow him to continue supporting his family and guarantee the safety of the young children that he transports. He is very conscious of the responsibility that comes with his job. The parents of these children put their trust in him. Ricardo has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and with Kiva. He was punctual with the payments on his first loan. He was also assured that his car was in good working order. His main goal is to see his three children become professionals and to have the satisfaction of having given them a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain his car that he uses to transport school-age children

loans.name: 02.07.18 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Ngat N. T. (33) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Ngat is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 18-Hanh Phuc (02-07-18-Nam Ngan). Ngat is married and has 1 adult child. To making a living, Ngat operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL.. Ngat has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2010, Ngat joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ngat has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngat plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. L. T. Nguyet (38) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Nga (34) is a 18 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 3. C. T. Hue (35) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 4. L. T. Luong (36) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. N. T. Quyet (37) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ngat N. T. (33) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Ngat là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 18-Hanh Phuc (02-07-18-Nam Ngan). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Ngat thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ngat kiếm được khoảng 3500000 VND. Vào 2010, Ngat đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ngat đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Nguyet (38) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Nga (34) là 18 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. C. T. Hue (35) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 4. L. T. Luong (36) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. N. T. Quyet (37) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maylinda owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Maylinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Maylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Maylinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Maylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn C. is from the village of Southwestern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business selling fish and shrimp in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn L. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, soap powder, and canned goods in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Marilyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,400 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma M.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Elma has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Elma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Gloria, quien tiene una unión libre hace 7 años y de esa relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 9, y 6 años que estudian en la escuela aun, su marido es chofer de un transporte particular.

Ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, producto al que entregan en Manta a comerciantes al por mayor para que estos envíen al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las  8am hasta las 12am, y 14h00 a 17h00, comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su casa, trabaja con ayuda de su cuñada, la materia prima la adquieren en Manta y en ciertos casos los agricultores le llevan a su casa.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto en estos momentos tiene un buen precio en el mercado. Esta en el Banco desde el principio y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande con mayor tecnología.
texts.en:
The Familiar Community Bank meets every two weeks in a town called Colorado located a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the people living in this location have different businesses such as manufacturing of buttons made of "tagua" (the hard white coating of a palm seed that is used as a substitute for ivory), crafts and trade in general. This is where we found Gloria. She has been in a common law marriage for 7 years and she has three children who are 10, 9 and 6 years old from this relationship. All children go to school. Her husband in a driver of private transportation. She has a "torno" (a machine used to cut "tagua") which is use to manufacture the buttons in crude form. The product is then delivered to whole sellers in Manta who send the buttons abroad to be finished. She works four days a week from 8am to 12pm and from 2pm to 5pm. She divides her time between her home and her work where she has her sister-in-law's help. They obtain the raw materials in Manta or sometimes the producers deliver them in her home. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials to increase her production. She wants to take advantage of the good market prices her merchandise currently has. She has been a partner of the Bank since its inception and she enjoys the payment advantages. Her dream is to have a factory with better technology.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase  "tagua" (a substitute for ivory used to make buttons)

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie B. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang, Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Margie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, eggs, etc. in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Margie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melissa Lisseth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Melissa es socia del banco hace dos ciclos y está muy contenta y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir ya que gracias a su primer préstamo puso su negocio.
 
Tiene 18 años y está soltera, dice que ella vivía en el campo pero que por sus estudios se vino a Colorado, vive en la casa de su tía, estudia en la Universidad de Manta.

Ella vende productos de AVON (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas) recorre con sus productos todas las tardes y en las noches  aprovecha en su Universidad para vender a sus amigas de clase, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente o por quincena, dice que siempre pide lo que sus clientes le solicitan y que hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien ya que le da para vivir y para sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas productos ya que tiene muchos pedidos y todavía no ha cobrado la mercadería que ha entregado.
 
Sus metas son terminar su carrera y luego ejercer su profesión como licenciada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familiar" meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Here the majority of the residents have different business such as making tagua buttons, handicrafts and business in general. Melissa has been a member of the bank for two cycles. She is very happy and grateful to Fundación Espoir since with her first loan she started her business. She is 18 years old and single. She says that she would live in the country, but her studies brought her to Colorado. She lives with her aunt and studies at the University of Manta. She travels every afternoon and evening selling Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and women's accessories) taking advantage of her university connections to sell to her classmates. She sells her products on credit and collects payments weekly or every 2 weeks. She says that she always orders what her customers request and, until now, it has gone very well since she has earned what she needs to live and for her studies. She will use this loan to buy more products since she has many orders and still has not collected on the merchandise that has been delivered. Her goals are to finish school and practice her profession as a graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Avon beauty products and perfumes

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Mr. Gerry C. is from the D. Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years of age and married to Marieta C.. They are blessed with 4 children of whom three are now teen-agers and the other one is an infant. To make a living, Gerry is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store business with his wife as his business partner. He’s been engaged in this kind of business for 7 years already and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month from this business activity. 

Just this year, Gerry joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, Gerry is now requesting a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 as his 1st loan to be used for additional capital for his existing sari-sari store business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion.
  
 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his existing sari-sari store

location.town: P4 D. Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental,

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan O. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older son attend a local secondary school while the younger daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Jargalsaihan used to work in a cafe from 2002 to 2010. She started to sell various kinds of household products especially those used in the kitchen in April, 2010. She has her own car which is used in their business. She is the kind of person who is hard-working and modest. She says, "Everything will be fine if you try hard."

 Jargalsaihan is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Aruinaa

texts.en:
Aruinaa D. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Tuv province, central Mongolia. She and her family have been living together at their current home address for 10 years. Her husband also works in their repair center. Her oldest son attends university and her younger two sons and daughter currently attend a local secondary school. In the future they plan to improve their living conditions as well as save money in order to pay their children's tuition fees for higher education. 

Aruinaa attended  Aktubinsk vocational training in Russia in gas welding from 1981 to 1983.  She has been operating a repair business of wheel and tires and other machinery with the help of her husband at a local town since 2003. Now they have purchased all kinds of equipment. 

In the future she hopes to have new car repair center with spare part sales. She is a modest and honest person.  Aruinaa is requesting a 500,000 MNT  loan to purchase more car repair supplies and tools.

loans.use: To purchase more car repair supplies and tools

loans.name: Johanna Leonor

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Johana tiene 26 años y está casada hace 9 años, de esta relación procreo tres hijos los cuales estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a labores del campo, trabaja cuando hay trabajo, en ocasiones pasa mucho tiempo sin trabajo.

Ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, producto al que entregan en Manta a comerciantes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes mucha veces sola y a veces con la ayuda de su marido cuando está desempleado, trabaja unas seis horas por día. La materia prima la va a comprar al campo por que dice que sale más barata ya que se la compran a los productores y esto le deja mejores ganancias.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto esta a buen precio en el mercado. Es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco y le gusta porque no piden tantos papeles para dar el crédito.
 
Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the residents here run various businesses such as the manufacture of ivory palm buttons, other crafts, and general trading. Johanna is 26 years old and has been married for 9 years. She and her husband have three children who are all in school. Her husband works in the fields, working when there is work; sometimes he goes a long time without work. Johanna has a lathe (a machine for cutting ivory palm) for roughly manufacturing buttons, a product that is delivered to merchants in Manta. She works about six hours a day, Monday to Friday, often by herself and sometimes with help from her husband when he is unemployed. She is going to buy the raw materials in the country, because she says it is cheaper to buy it from the growers, and this will provide greater earnings. Johanna will use this loan to buy raw materials. She wants to increase her production to take advantage of the good market prices for her product. This is her second cycle in the Bank, and she likes it because they do not request so many papers for giving out loans. Her dream is to provide a good education for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ivory palm.

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a rice farmer who is able to make about US$ 2 per day. She has been farming since 2000. She has three children; two are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a traditional musician. He makes US$ 3 a day. He earns the most from December to May. 

Rath S. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio T. is from the village of San Vicente. He is 48 years old. Antonio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy C. is 39 years old and sells fruit in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about two years and she makes US$ 5 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to increase her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit

loans.name: Murathan

texts.en:
Murathan H. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic housing tent in Bayan-Ulgiy province, in the western part of Mongolia. His two daughters, ages one and five, both stay at home. 

Murathan and his wife began their food retailing business in 2005 at a small stall near their home with working capital of 150,000 MNT (about 113 USD). Over the years of successful operation the two have gained much experience and increased their assortment and provide a variety of goods for their customers. Now their working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT (about 1883 USD). 

Murathan's wife has also makes many kinds of needlework products and sells them out of her small shop. Murathan is planning to expand his business, and hopes to one day own his own big shop. He says,  "In order not to spend so much on the transportation of products, I am planning to purchase a small car for my business." He is requesting a 3,650,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing and consumer goods from Tashkent, a border city of China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and consumer goods for resale

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn S. is 36 years old and sells fruits in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about two years and she makes US$ 5 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation, and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to increase her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit

loans.name: Miriam Fátima

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Miriam es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta por la ayuda que siempre ha recibido.

Tiene 31 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 15 años y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja con aluminio y vidrio (elabora puertas y ventanas).

Ella tiene un local de comida rápida  en La Pradera en Manta, donde vende salchichas, asados y otros ricos platos que se preparan con la carne de cerdo. También compra chanchos a los cuales los faena en su casa y luego los traslada a su local donde vende la carne y todo los productos que salen del chancho, este trabajo lo realiza con su esposo tres  días a la semana pero su negocio de comida es todos los días desde 14h00 hasta las 19h00.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mesas y sillas para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y que sea reconocido en todo Manta y porque no en el país.
texts.en:
The village bank "Familiar" (Family) meets every 15 days in a town called Colorado, which is a few minutes from Montecristi. In this place, most of the residents have different businesses such as making buttons from tagua (the very hard seed of a palm tree), craftwork, and general business. La señora Miriam is a founding member of the village bank and is pleased with the help she has always received. She is 31 years old. She has been in a common-law marriage for 15 years and has three children. Her husband works with aluminum and glass (making doors and windows). She has a fast food site in La Pradera in Manta where she sells sausages, barbequed meat, and other delicious dishes prepared from pork. She also buys pork which she cuts up at home and then takes to her site to sell the meat and all the products which come from the pork. She does this work with her husband three days a week, but her food site is open every day from 2 p.m. to 7 p.m. This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs and threreby provide more convenience for her customers. Her dream is to expand her business and be recognized throughout Manta and perhaps through all of Ecuador.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem T., 54, is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$ 1 each day, while her husband works in construction making US$ 2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Tem T. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy R. is an old man whose wife appears in the photograph. Suy R. has been spending his life cultivating crops, a skill he learned from his grandparents when he was young. He is now married and has two children who are already married. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. 

Growing crops is an annual business with which he has had great success. Mr. Suy R. requests a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer and crop seed to grow.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizer and crop seed

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay Y., 52, is a widow with two children and lives in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling noodles at the local market. On average, she is able to make about US$ 3 each day. She is also supported by one daughter who is employed as garment factory worker. 

Svay Y.’s daughter spends about US$ 0.50 every day on transportation and this makes her family face difficulties with daily transportation. Seeing this as a difficulty, Mrs. Svay Y. is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. (Svay Y. is pictured with her daughter at her home.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Angela Delgado. Ella esta casada hace 20 años y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años la ultima estudia y este año se incorpora del colegio por lo cual ella está muy feliz, su esposo es obrero temporal.

Ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, producto al que entregan en Manta a comerciantes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes hasta ocho horas por día, trabaja sola y a veces con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo, la materia prima la consigue en Manta y la guarda en su casa, lo cual es un problema ya que su casa no es muy segura.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para arreglar su casa, va poner puertas y ventanas nuevas que le ofrezcan más seguridad. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan a todas las socias y porque no piden tantos requisitos para los créditos.
 
Su sueño son terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The Familiar community bank meets every 15 days in the small Ecuadorean town of Colorado. The town's inhabitants operate a range of businesses, from making and selling crafts to general commerce. We are talking with Sra. Angela Delgado. Angela has been married for 20 years and she has two children, 19 and 17 years old. The younger child will finish school this year, something that pleases her very much. Angela's husband is a seasonal laborer. Angela has a lathe for turning tacua, a semi-precious stone, from which she makes buttons. She then sells the buttons to merchants in Manta. She works eight hours a day from Mondays to Fridays. Her children and husband help her sometimes, but she generally works alone. She buys raw materials for her buttons in Manta and stores them at home. The problem is that her house isn't very secure. This loan will be used to buy new doors and windows so that Angela can make the house more secure. She has been a member of the community bank since the beginning and likes that the requirements for getting a loan are relatively easy to meet. Angela's dream is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doors and windows.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo Y. is from the village of San Vicente. He is 40 years old. Herminigildo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Herminigildo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Herminigildo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Herminigildo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminigildo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Herminigildo is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Herminigildo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Mariana tiene 59 años es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, los primeros 4 son casados y el ultimo que es  soltero vive con ella, nos cuenta con lagrimas en los ojos que su esposo falleció hace cuatro años pero  ella  todavía no lo ha podido superar.

Después que su esposo murió puso una pequeña fábrica de botones, ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones, producto al que entrega en Manta a comerciantes al por mayor, estos envíen al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja de lunes a viernes  y los sábados selecciona los botones para llevarlos a vender, compra en Manta la tagua semirajada que es la que ella utiliza ya que es más rápida de trabajar.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto esta en estos momentos a buen precio en el mercado.
 
Esta en el Banco Comunal hace dos años, le trajo una amiga y le ha gustado porque siempre estos créditos le ayudan  mucho.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio hasta que Dios lo quiera.
texts.en:
The Familiar Communal Bank meets every fortnight in a town called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the inhabitants of this area run different businesses, such as the manufacture of buttons from the tagua nut (“vegetable ivory”), other crafts and general trading. Here lives Mariana, who is 59 years old and a widow with five children. The four eldest are married and the youngest is single and lives with her. With tears in her eyes, she tells us that her husband died four years ago but she is still grieving. After her husband died, she set up a small button factory. She has a lathe (a machine for cutting the tagua) which she uses to make the buttons. She then delivers the product to wholesalers in Manta, who send them abroad to be finished. She works from Monday to Friday and on Saturdays she selects the buttons she will take to be sold. She buys semi-processed tagua in Manta, using this kind because it is faster to work with. She will use this loan to buy raw materials because she would like to increase her production and benefit from her product currently being sold at a decent price in the market. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for two years – a friend introduced her and she is delighted with it, as these loans are always a great help to her. Her goal is to develop her business while it is God's will.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tagua.

loans.name: Moung

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a single mother caring for a daughter who is no longer enrolled in school and currently works as a sewing laborer in the garment industry. Mrs. S. was previously married but husband died of senility years ago. To earn a living, Mrs. S. sells boiled corn to nearby neighbors in the village. She is taking out her first loan to buy a secondhand motor for her daughter to use to commute to her workplace without hiring a taxi. Any money remaining from the loan Mrs. S. plans to use as extra capital to sustain her business growth.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motor

loans.name: María Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Para  la señora María este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado porque siempre se divierte en las reuniones y por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace dos meses y tiene dos hijos de otra relación los cuales ya están en colegio y escuela.

Tiene una pequeña fábrica de botones, en un torno (máquina para cortar tagua)  elabora los botones pero en forma cruda, producto al que entrega en Manta a comerciantes al por mayor, estos envíen al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja sola de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 16h00,  la materia prima la adquiere en Manta y en otros casos va a comprar al campo donde ya conoce a algunos productores que le venden la tagua limpia, ya lleva tres años en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto esta en estos momentos a buen precio en el mercado.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The Familiar Communal Bank meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, which is a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the inhabitants of this place have different businesses like making buttons from “tagua” (the hard white coating of a specific palm seed that is used as a substitute for elephant ivory), handicrafts, and general commerce. This is Maria’s third cycle in her communal bank. She has really liked it because she always enjoys herself at the meetings, and she like the ease of securing the loans. She is 39 years old, and she has been in a common-law marriage for two months. She has two children from another relationship, and both of them go to school. She has a small factory making buttons. She uses a machine for cutting tagua, and makes unfinished buttons. She delivers her product wholesale to merchants in Manta. These merchants send the buttons to foreign countries to be finished. She only works from Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She gets the raw material in Manta. Sometimes she shops in the countryside where she knows some producers who sell pure tagua. She has been in this business for three years, and it has gone very well for her. She will use this loan to buy raw material because she wants to increase her production. She wants to take advantage of the fact that her product is currently selling in the market for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy “tagua” (the hard white coating of a specific palm seed that is used as a substitute for elephant ivory)

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Mrs. Elmie D. is presently employed at Charm Crystals and Beauty Salon as a beautician and massage therapist. Also, she has a jewelry and dried fish business. She is 27 years of age, married and blessed with two young children. They are from the Barangay of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is receiving regular support from her husband, who works as a security guard for MOELCI II, an electric cooperative company. She’s been employed for three years and has been in the jewelry and dried fish dealing business for two years. She earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. Just this year, Elmie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC, she is now requesting a Regular Loan of 10,000 PHP as her first loan to be used as additional capital for her jewelry and dried fish vending business. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family: especially to meet their basic needs, save for future use, make loan repayments, pay for insurance and the children’s education, and possibly to make business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. texts.en: Thao L. T. (125) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Thao owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. Thao has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 700,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2007, Thao joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enabL. her to engage in business activities. Thao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thao plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Thao is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. T. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thao L. T. (125) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Thao là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh (030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thao thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thao kiếm được khoảng 700,000 VND. Vào 2007, Thao đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thao đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Khieu (88) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa F. is from the village of Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
