loans.name: Ena Paola

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Ena tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de una hermosa bebe de 7 meses de nacida, vive con su pequeña en la casa de sus padres, en la cual viven 5 personas ya que tiene un hermano menor. Dice que su vida ha sido muy difícil por su condición pero que poco a poco está saliendo adelante.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa donde vende frutas y verduras, trabaja desde 6am hasta las 16h00, trabaja sola y comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y el cuidado de su hija a pesar de que su mama le ayuda, compra sus productos en Portoviejo ya que allá los consigue mas baratos y de mejor calidad para brindar a sus clientes lo mejor y es por eso que la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas productos para surtir mejor su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 ciclos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de realizar.
 
Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeña y construir una casa para ella.
texts.en:
The Family Community Bank meets every 15 days in a town called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the people in this area run businesses in different industries such as manufacturing tagua (type of vegetable ivory, an alternative to animal derived ivory) buttons, crafts, and general trade. Ena is 22 years old and a single mother of a beautiful 7-month-old baby. She lives with her daughter in her parents' house, along with 5 other people and her younger brother. She says that her life has been very difficult in her situation but she is slowly moving forward. She has a small stall in her home where she sells fruits and vegetables from 6 am to 4 pm. She works alone and divides her time between working and caring for her daughter, although her mother also helps out. She buys her products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper and better there, so she can offer her customers the best. This loan will be used to buy more products to better stock her business. Ena has belonged to the Communal Bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because payments can be made easily. Her dreams are to build a house and provide the best for her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en: Agung Ayu Putu W. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Agung Ayu is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Agung Ayu owns and operates a business venture in traveling sales. She goes to the farmers and buys their cacao bean, banana fruit, jack fruit, coconuts, young coconut leaves, cassava and so on, and then sells them in the market. Agung Ayu has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Agung Ayu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first loan from MUK. Agung Ayu plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Agung Ayu is the leader of a 15 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "KWT Sawe Permata Indah (PK-10308)". About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Agung Ayu Putu W. (0) merupakan 47 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Agung Ayu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah KWT Sawe Permata Indah (PK-10308). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari membudidayakan tanaman buah & memanen buahnya untuk dijual. Agung Ayu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Agung Ayu menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Agung Ayu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Agung Ayu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.name: Patricia Felicita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Patricia tiene 46 años de edad y esta casada hace 23 años, tiene tres hijos dos mayores y el último que está aún en el colegio, dos de sus hijos viven con ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, aunque reconoce que lo que mas vende es interiores y ropa de damas, trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana, en los cuales entrega los pedidos y realiza los cobros que son semanales y en ciertos casos quincenales, ella vende en Montecristi y también en Manta, compra en Guayaquil Y en Huaquillas ciudades que visita una o dos veces por mes de acuerdo a la demanda que tenga de sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar en Huaquillas ropa interior y jean de mujeres ya que tiene muchos encargos. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta por las reuniones informativas y educativas.

Su meta es construir otro piso en su casa ya que es muy pequeña la que tiene.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the residents here run various businesses such as the manufacture of ivory palm buttons, other crafts, and general trading. Patricia is 46 years old and has been married for 23 years. She has three children, two adults and one who is still in school. Two of their children live with her. Patricia sells all kinds of clothing, although what she sells most are undergarments and women's clothing. She works the last three days of the week, during which she delivers orders and collects weekly, or in some cases biweekly, payments. She makes sales in Montecristi and also in Manta. She makes purchases in Guayaquil and in Huaquillas, where she visits once or twice a month according to the demand for her products. Patricia will invest this loan in the purchase of undergarments and women's jeans in Huaquillas, given that she has many orders for them. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for four cycles and enjoys the informative, educational meetings. Patricia's goal is to build another story on her house, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy undergarments and women's jeans.

Ngan N. T. (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Ngan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Dong Ve (08.02.01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ngan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ngan kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Ngan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ngan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda M. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan. She is 28 years old. Roda is married. To make a living, Roda provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. texts.en: Quy N. T. (21) is a 53-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Quy is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030132-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh (030132-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh). Quy is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Quy operates a family member's fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Quy has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,800,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it. In 2001, Quy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Quy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. texts.en: To make a living, Lucia S. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has six grown-up children. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Kulbara

texts.en:
Kulbara K.  lives in the northwest of Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has four children. She graduated from the Kyrgyz National University and works as a teacher of mathematics in the local school. She is known as a person who sets her whole heart on her pupils' education. Taking into account her striving to make children progressive, she is titled as an Honoured Education Worker.  

As it is known, in rural areas, the salaries of teachers are low and do not cover all the expenses of a household. That’s why these people need to find an additional means of subsistence for their families. Kulbara, like many others in such a situation, began her own business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Starting from buying one cow, she managed to enlarge the number of livestock to 10 sheep, one milk cow, one calf and one horse. Also, Kulbara has a beautiful small-scale garden with apples, pears and raspberries, which gives her some earnings for supporting her children. For her family use, she dries these fruits and makes provisions for the winter. 
 
Now, Kulbara wants to take a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) to buy five bull-calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from this investment, she plans to build a house for her family. In the future, Kulbara plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Mr. Um R.'s daily routine. He provides a tailoring service to his neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. He runs his business very well and his customers recognize the good service he provides. His wife Chanthy, 30, works with him sewing clothes. Um R. owns a piece of land where he plans to plant crops for additional income. As he lacks the necessary money for this he decided to request a loan.

loans.use: To use towards growing crops.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia T. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Arsenia raises pigs for fattening and sale. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Arsenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Arsenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Emerla

texts.en:
Emerla M. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 and married and with six adult children. To make a living, Emerla runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emerla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Emerla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Emerla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly V., from the village of Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya, is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beverly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided, Beverly is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 7,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoem N., 55, is homemaker caring for her six children, two of whom are employed in the garment industry. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a domestic building laborer at various construction sites around his community. 

Khoem is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$1,200 to purchase a plot of land that has become available in a good location for farming.  Upon that land she will plant a variety of crops for extra income.

loans.use: To buy farmland upon which to plant a variety of crops for extra income.

loans.name: Maria Teresa's Group

texts.en: Maria Teresa G. is from Barangay 4, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 24 years old and is the group leader of this twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Maria Teresa is married and has one infant child. She owns and operates a motorcycle repair business, providing repair services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maria Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve her business. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve her business

loans.name: 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Tuyet L. T. (103) is a 46-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Tuyet is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Tuyet is married and has two adult children. She operates a family member's business venture selling lighting products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, Tuyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tuyet is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Tai (107) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. T. Hoa (108) is a 43-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising crops. 3. N. T. Can (117) is a 63-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Tuyet L. T. (103) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Tuyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm chiếu sáng cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Tuyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 16 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyet kiếm được khoảng 6,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, Tuyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tuyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Tai (107) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Hoa (108) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 3. N. T. Can (117) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nhoeum

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoeum K. is a 42-year-old married woman who currently lives in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is blessed with three children: one of her daughters works in the garment factory, while the other two attend school. Her husband (shown in the photo) is a fisherman and also a construction worker.

Nhoeum K. sells fish and vegetables in the market; she started selling more than eight years ago. In addition, she also plants a few crops around her house for the dual purpose of eating and selling.

Nhoeum K. requested a loan of $1,200 to be used to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her daily profit.

loans.use: To increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her daily profit

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan S. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses and employs a few laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses and he also goes to work from construction site to construction site.

Chan S. has another partner in his wife, who works sewing in a factory. He has two school-aged kids, who are dependent on him.

The family’s house breaks down during heavy rainfall and needs repairs frequently. Chan S. will be using his loan to mend his old house.

loans.use: To mend his old house

loans.name: 030212- Tay Hai- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Hai D. T. (105) is a 29-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030212- Tay Hai- Hoang Thanh (030212- Tay Hai- Hoang Thanh). Hai is married and has three school-aged children. She operates a family member's business venture providing furniture-rental services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2007, Hai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve her business. Hai is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase equipment to improve her business. The loan will be her 5th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Thuong (20) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 2. L. T. Loan (104) is an 18-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. H. T. Hue (107) is a 27-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hai D. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030212- Tay Hai- Hoang Thanh (030212- Tay Hai- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ cho thuê trang T.ết bị cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Vào 2007, Hai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị để cải T.ện công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 2. L. T. Loan (104) là 18 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. H. T. Hue (107) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve her furniture-rental business

loans.name: Seakkouy

texts.en:
Mrs. Seakkouy P. (pictured here) is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. San Sorn, is 38 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and another one stays at home. 

Sokkouy sells Toek Kork Chhose at home. Toek Kork Chhose is considered a slush or shaved-ice dessert made with milk and sugar. Her husband has been selling ice cream in the nearby village.  

Sokkouy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin T. is a single mother of two children. One of her children is already married and lives independently, while the remaining one stays at home and works sewing clothes in industry. 

Yin T. has been cultivating crops to earn a living. As the farming season approaches, Yin T. lacks money to plant a rice crop and is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mr. Mach C. is 65 years old (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Yean Houn, is 55 years old. They have been married since 1969. They have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, while one attends school and another one stays at home. The family lives across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. 

Mach is a chief of a commune. His wife is a farmer. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase buffaloes for his son to raise.

loans.use: To purchase buffaloes for his son to raise

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mrs. Von S. works sewing clothes in a factory and has been engaged in her job since 2009. She has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a military policeman in the ministry of interior. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their one kid, who attends the public local school. 

Von S. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Von S. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak P. (in the photo), 46, and his wife, Mrs. Channa Ponh, 47, were married in 2002 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and another one has full-time employment. They are living in a small village on National Road Number 2 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophak has been raising pigs for two years. In addition, he grows rice as well. His wife is a garment-factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase food for his pigs and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy food for his pigs and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mariza Lena

texts.pt:
A foto foi tirada no local do negócio devido a distância que o mesmo se localiza.


Marisa Lena S. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província do mesmo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 3 a 16 anos de idade os mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez somente 7ª classe e não continuou porque perdeu vaga devido a idade e os pais não permitiram para fazer curso noturno. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane com sua mãe ainda nova, tem um negócio próprio de venda de frangos congelados em caixas ha mais de 5 anos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 900.00mt por dia, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (caixas de frango congelado) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo. No futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno.
texts.en:
Marisa Lena S. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, located in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children whose ages range from 3 to 16. The older children attend school. Marisa only studied through 7th grade because at that age she lost her allotted place in the school and her parents wouldn't let her study on a nighttime schedule. She lives in her own house with her family and is not responsible for supporting any other family members.

Marisa came to Boane from Maputo with her mother when she was young. For more than 5 years she has run a business selling boxes of frozen chicken, making around 900 meticais a day. She uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. 

Marisa has never taken out loans with any other banks, and she found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner] through neighbors who also work with the institution. This is her first loan, for 20,000 meticais. She will use the money to buy more boxes of frozen chicken to increase her stock of merchandise. 

Marisa is confident that she will be able to repay the loan even sooner than required so that she is eligible for a new loan. In the future she would like to build a better space for her business.

The photo was not taken at Marisa's business because it is located some distance away.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (boxes of frozen chicken)

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov B. (pictured here), 29, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her parents and brother in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her parents are farmers. 

Pov is a garment-factory worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $200 to help fund her parent’s farming business.

loans.use: To help fund her parent’s farming business

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang S. is 55 years old, and her husband, Mr. Ton Nao, is 58 years old  (pictured together). They have been married since 1979 and have four children:  three sons and one daughter. One of the children is married and the others attend school (two are in university). The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

This couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. Savang and her husband are farmers; they grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. The couple hopes to support their children with further education, so Savang is asking for her first loan of $500 to pay school fees for her children who are attending university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Siyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Siyet T., 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Pov Yan, 49 years old, have been married since 1986 and have six children:  two sons and four daughters. One sells beauty products, three attend school, one is a garment factory worker and another is a traditional musician. They live with their parents about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Siyet has been running a grocery store at home for ten years. Her husband has full-time employment. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase beauty products and grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan C., 22, is a local tailor. She sews and repairs clothes for nearby villagers. She also buys small pieces of cloth from a factory and turns them into sets of furniture to sell. Kan C. is married to Mr. Piset, 20, who assists her with the tailoring business. This couple doesn’t have any children yet (they hope to have a child next year). 

Kan C. currently needs to hire a taxi to pick up cloth she buys from the factory to bring it to her house. She wants to have a vehicle to meet her traveling needs. As she doesn’t have money to buy one, Kan C. decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to purchase a motor with trailer attached, so she can use this vehicle to transport cloth without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To purchase a motor with trailer attached

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy S. is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Morn, is 43 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter, all of them in school. They live with their parents about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital of Cambodia.

Chanthy and her husband are farmers; they grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. However, the couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their rice and vegetable farm. Hence, Chanthy is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to help her capital. 

In the photo, Chanthy and her husband are at home and not on their farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for their farm

loans.name: Senghab

texts.en:
Mr. Senghab C., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Ny Sok, 36, have been married since 1993 and have five sons, all of them in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Senghab’s wife is shown in the photo.

Senghab has been selling cows and oxen for twenty years while his wife stays at home and does housework. He hopes to expand his business, so he is applying for a loan of 800 USD to purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional cows and oxen for resale

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mr. Nao S. is highly skilled at building stone houses and has been using his knowledge to earn a living. He has a life partner in his wife, who appears in the photo above. She farms rice crops on their own farmland. This couple was married many years ago, but they have no children yet.

Mr. Nao S. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, he is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Albertina Atalia

texts.pt:
Albertina Atalia H. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, casada mãe de um 4 filhos de 6 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Sai de Maputo para o reino da Suazilândia com o seu esposo e regressaram em 1996, onde iniciaram a actividade comercial para sustentar a família. Vende frangos vivos, não possui empregados e consegue cerca de 4.000.00 por semana, onde aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa e no banco. 

Ja teve empréstimo no Novo Banco e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que trabalham juntas e que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais pintos ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo. No futuro pretende construir aviário ainda maior.
texts.en:
Albertina Atalia H. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is a married mother of four children who are between 6 and 19 years old. All of her children attend school. She only completed 7th grade herself and did not continue because of financial reasons. She lives in her own home with her family and she supports her mother by sending her some money for her household expenses.

She left Maputo for Swaziland with her husband, and returned in 1996, when she began her business to support her family. She sells live chickens, she does not have any employees, and she makes about 4000 per week, which she uses for her household expenses and invests some in her home and her bank account.

She has taken out a previous loan with Novo Banco and decided not to continue. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who work with her and who are already clients of the institution. This is her first loan for 20,000mt, with which she will purchase more chicks, feed, and vitamins to increase her stock.

She is confidant that she can repay the loan on time and hopes to seek an additional loan. In the future, she wants to build a better aviary.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Sokoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. SokoeU. U., is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Phai Put, is 40 years old. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them in school.

SokoeU. and her husband are farmers: they grow bananas and ginger on their farmland in the village. However, the couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm. Therefore, SokoeU. is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to help her capital.

In the photo, SokoeU. is shown at her home and not on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm

loans.name: Adelina Jacinto

texts.pt:
Adelina Jacinto M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, casada mãe de um 4 filhos de 1 a 12 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada e falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos, vende mais frangos e sumo. Não possui empregados e consegue cerca de 10.000.00 a 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitqui (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que trabalham juntas e que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, sumo, arroz, farinha bolachas, biscoitos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Adelina Jacinto M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is married, and is the mother of 4 children between the ages of one and 12 years. The two oldest children attend school. She completed the 10th grade herself but did not continue because of an unplanned pregnancy and lack of finances. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has never left her home town. She has been in business more than 4 years, selling more chickens and juices. She doesn't have any employees and makes between 10,000 and 12,000mt per month, which she uses for her household expenses and saves some through Xitqui (a traditional rotational savings system).

She has never taken out a loan from another bank. She learned of Hluvuku through friends she works with who are already clients of the institution. This is her first loan for 20,000mt. She will use these funds to buy products such as chickens, juices, rice, biscuits and cookies, etc. to increase her stock.

She is confident that she can repay her loan on time and hopes to seek another in the future to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase of products (chickens, juice, rice, flour biscuits, cookies, and others)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia B. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and is married. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jiji has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jiji joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jiji has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jiji is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jiji from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Mary Grace joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Chona

She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling kabab pork and chicken in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida L. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and single. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising and selling pigs.  She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This will be Florida’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

To make a living, Benson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. She has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel T. is from the village of Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old and single with one school-aged child. To make a living, Razel owns a retail store selling daily use products such as eggs, sardines, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Razel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Razel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Razel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Razel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah N. is 40-years-old. She is single and a mother of two school going children.
Serah is a farmer and farms on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last six years.

Serah learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the loan to prepare land for planting whea. Wheat has proved to be doing very well due to favorable climatic conditions. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to plough a bigger piece of land for farming to increase her wheat production. 

Her future dream is to become a large scale wheat farmer in her area.

She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting wheat

loans.name: Harrison Ayugi

texts.en:
Harrison has been extracting stones from his quarry site in Naivasha town since 2004.  He is 53 years old, married to Mary Auma and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to employ two more people to help him in stone extraction with the proceeds from the loan.

In future, Harrison is planning to buy a second hand lorry which he will use to transport the stones from his site to where the clients are.

loans.use: To employ two  more people to help him in stone extraction

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre A. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old. Silvestre is separated from his spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Silvestre owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Silvestre has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Silvestre joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestre is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Silvestre from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Janyl

texts.en:
Janyl S. is young farmer, who lives in Ak-Jar village, in the north –west of Kyrgyzstan. She is 28, married and has three children. Janyl graduated from medical college and works as a nurse at the local ambulance room. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her children, Janyl decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. Using her initial capital of 3,500 KGS, she bought only one calf. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts and today she has two milk cows, two calves, and three horses. Also, Janyl started to engage in bee-farming, which became her favorite activity. At present days, she has 12 bee-families and earns about 8,000 KGS monthly from selling the products of bee keeping. 

Now Janyl applies for  loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more milk cows that will allow her to increase milk sales and enlarge the number of customers. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 60-year-old widow and a mother of nine children aged between 17 and 40. Mary supports a family of four because most of her children have their own families. Mary runs a mini retail shop, which she started three years ago. This business gives her an average profit of 5,000 KES per month.

This is Mary's third loan and she is requesting to borrow 20,000 KES, of which 5,000 KES will be used to buy one bag of sugar, 3,000 KES to buy two boxes of tea leaves, and 2,000 KES to purchase two boxes of bar soap. The balance of Kes 10,000 will be used to pay school fees for two of her children. Mary hopes to use her business profits to expand the business and save for future use. 

Mary's hopes and dreams are to expand her business to wholesale and have her own car.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Eddie

Eddie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Eddie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abraham Kipleting

texts.en:
Abraham Kipleting T. is a 31-year-old businessman who operates a dairy business, selling his product to his customers to earn a profit. He is married to Rhoda Jelimo T., who is 22 years old, and they have two children age five years and two years. He runs his business in Kapseret, 10km from Eldoret town and has been in this business for the past three years.

Abraham was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he has no other history with any micro-financial institution. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET which he plans to use to purchase two dairy cows.

Abraham hopes to operate a large-scale dairy farm, whereby he will be able to supply milk to hotels (restaurants), sell the best quality milk to his customers and, in the future, extend the same services to companies like KCC, Brookside.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Elijah Kimeli

texts.en:
Elijah Kimeli K. is a 39-year-old businessman who sells dairy products like milk and also sells cattle to his customers at a profit. He is married to Emily Jepkemei, who is 32 years old, and they have no children at the moment but have four relatives that live with them. Elijah runs his business in Kapseret, ten kilometers from Eldoret town, and has been in this business for about four years.

Elijah was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he has no history with any other micro-finance institution. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET which he plans to use to purchase more cattle to sell later at a profit.

Elijah hopes to operate a large cattle farm, whereby he will be able to supply the best quality milk for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
A. Alisher, who lives in Dj. Rasulov district, Tajikistan, is dedicated to the farming and cattle business which he attends to very diligently in his community.

In order to bring food to his table for his spouse and his beloved three children,  Alisher starts very early in the morning to tend to the animals and returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all this. He says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education in future.

Now, Alisher would like to expand his business and purchase calves plus seed and fertilizer for cultivating his land. For this purpose, he has applied for $2,500 USD. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves plus seed and fertilizer for cultivating his land

loans.name: Benjamin Kiprotich

texts.en:
Benjamin Kiprotich M. is a 32-year-old man who is married to Ursila Jepchirchir. They have two children aged four years and six months old respectively. They live in Kapseret, ten kilometers from Eldoret town.

Benjamin operates a motorbike transport service from which he earns his income. He has been in this business for the past ten years, generating an income of Kshs 12,000 per month.

Benjamin was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET. With this loan he plans to purchase another motorbike.

Benjamin hopes, with the income he is going to make, to invest more in the transportation sector and, in future, to buy a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Rodith

texts.en: To make a living, Rodith T. buys and sells seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Rodith has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Rodith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rodith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Rodith is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en: P. Rustamjon is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day to improve the living conditions of his family, bring the daily bread to his table and save for the improvement of his dwelling. His house needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state which, little by little, he has come to improve. His family admires him since his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and keep his three children in school. This gentleman faces a need to invest in his business through the purchase of cows. He hopes that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, will offer him this loan so he and his family can do well. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Mrs. Sot C. is 44 years of age. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. In order to meet the needs of the family, Sot C. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has had experience in this sector for five years and is earning approximately $4 per day. She has three children:  one of them is employed in a guest house and the other two are going to school. Sot C. has requested a loan to purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family

loans.name: Susan Jebet

texts.en:
Susan is a 38-year-old mother of four and married to Mr. K. who is a businessman. She has been in the used clothes business for 18 years now and has a good number of customers who keep returning to check on new arrivals and make purchases. She makes a profit of more than 10,000 KES every month and from it she has been able to support her family.
Susan learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a friend who is also a KADET client. This is her second loan with KADET and she plans to use it to buy additional stock such as jackets, dresses and curtains to ensure a continued supply to her customers. Her future plan is to own a big second-hand wholesale business and supply others who are in the business of used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Rowena Agustin's Group

texts.en:
Rowena A. is from the village of Amobocan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Rowena is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rowena joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Mrs. Marilyn R. is from the Barangay (neighborhood or village) of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years of age, married and blessed with three children, all of whom are now of school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in gardening. She earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this business activity. In the year 2009, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. She has successfully repaid a loan amount of 5,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan amount of 8,000 PHP as her third loan. It will be used for the financing of her agricultural activities, specifically for purchasing fertilizers and labor for cultivation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for a future use, loan repayments, her children’s education, insurance and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old, married to Jonathan Rotich.  They have been blessed with three children: Kiprop (15 years old), Emilly (6 years old) and June (3 years old).  Martha does small scale farming for a living.

Martha has requested a loan of 15,000 KES. She intends to use 3,000 KES for fertilizers, 5,000 KES to buy beans and peas seeds and 7,000 KES for labor and other overhead costs.

Martha has been in the farming business for the last five years.  She makes an average profit of 8,000 KES per month.  She plans to use the profits from the business to expand it and save the rest for her children's education.  Her dreams and hopes are that she will be able to do large scale farming and be able to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mr. Pon P. is 29 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  Pon is away from home often to work from building site to building site around the city.  By doing this, he is able to make $4 a day to help with his family's financial crisis.  In additional to his construction job, Pon owns a cart that he uses to sell sugar cane juice. He has a wife who sews clothes in a garment factory.  Pon has been constructing his own house for a long time, but the building process is never completed due to the lack of funds. Because of this, Pon is applying for a loan in order to continue building his house.

loans.use: To continue building his house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single woman living with her parents. She lives in Lebanon. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a beautician. Her business is based from her home and she also works as traveler beautician. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in more materials for her work; she will purchase a laser and a wax machine. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in more materials for her work

Ruon E. has a partner in her husband, who is skilled in building wooden houses. The couple works together to feed their three unmarried children. Ruon E. will be using her loan to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her income.
