loans.name: 03.01.02 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Yen T. T. (9) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Yen is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Dien Bien (03.01.02 Dien Bien).

Yen is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Yen runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Yen has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Yen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  T. T. Hue (178) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

2.  T. T. Oanh (7) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yen T. T. (9) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Yen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dien Bien (03.01.02 Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Yen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yen kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Yen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Hue (178) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  T. T. Oanh (7) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Naomi is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Naomi runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling caned goods, milk, soap and spices. Naomi has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Naomi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naomi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Naomi is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Naomi from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S., from the village of Biasong, is a 56-year-old widowed mother of nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets, she is now requesting a new loan, her 12th, of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Rosie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mr. Men M. is an older man whose wife appears in the photograph above. Men M. owns a piece of farmland that he and his wife use to grow different kinds of crops from which they earn a living. This old couple has four teenage children: two are employed and two are jobless. Men M. wants to encourage his unemployed children to have suitable jobs. As they don’t have money yet, Men M. has applied for a loan for his children to use as capital to begin selling grocery items in the village. The loan will provide the family with extra income and a better standard of living.

loans.use: To begin selling grocery items

Luzvilla owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Luzvilla has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Luzvilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Jacob Njoroge

texts.en:
Jacob has been in the quarry business for 5 years now. He is 32 years old, married to Hannah Wambui and they have two children.

Jacob was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 15,000 well and on time. He plans to employ another person to increase production and meet the demand at his work site. Jacob also has plans of opening up a hardware shop in Naivasha in the future.

loans.use: to employ another person to increase production and meet the demand

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith C. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Bernadith owns and operates a specialized retail store, dealing and selling clothing and shoe products from a supplier in the local community. Bernadith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Bernadith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Bernadith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

He says he has gotten the strength to move on through his wife who is also a hardworking businesswoman.

Peter plans to use this first loan to buy additional used clothes and also diversify by buying used shoes and household items.He plans to own a wholesale shoe shop in the future.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas O. is 33 years old, married to a tailor and has two children: ages 2 and 3 years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. His business is located in a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for the production of sugar cane. He has been selling sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and salt for four years now and has one employee. Silas says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to restock. He hopes to purchase a plot of land and build his own house in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and salt

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter works in a secondary school as an English teacher. The second daughter is studying at university with graduation next spring. The youngest son studies at secondary school. 

Mrs. Oyuntsetseg’s family used to live in Uvurkhangai Aimag, a southwest province of Mongolia, and she was a teacher in kindergarten. Her husband used to be a herder raising livestock. In 1996, they lost almost all their livestock because of the harsh winter in Mongolia. Then, they had to move to Ulaanbaatar city in search of a better life, but they could not find any suitable jobs for them. She and her husband decided to collect different kinds of recyclable waste and sell it to waste exporting and recycling companies for a profit. Now they have an established business with 14 years of experience. They say that they are very proud of keeping society tidy and at the same time making a profit out of it. 

They are one of Credit Mongol's reliable customers. The latest loan they have taken out has been used to buy a plot of land. And now Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is planning to build a house on their land. She has the project ready to go. The plan is to have the basement and basic structure of the house done before December, 2010, and the rest of the job will be completed during spring, 2011. The reason she is requesting this loan is she wants to buy all the necessary materials for the house and complete the basement and basic structure of the house before the winter.

loans.use: To buy all the necessary materials for a house and complete the basement and basic structure of the house before the winter

loans.name: Jagapar

texts.en: Jagapar Z. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son is a student, his middle daughter attends a local elementary school and his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. His wife works as a nurse in a local hospital. Jagapar has been operating a small outdoor billiards area at the local market in his town since 2005. He owns a billiard table that people can use while they are shopping. He has used his daily earnings to provide for his household's needs and has not created any savings yet. He hopes to expand his business and to operate a clothes trading business in the near future . He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase one more billiard table.

loans.use: To purchase one more billiard table

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy C. is 36 years old and sells fruits in Takeo province. She has been in business for about four years and she makes US$10 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who earns, on average, US$5 a day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business as inflation is high and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Soy is asking for a loan of US$1000 to increase her stock of fruits to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora N. is a widowed lady with six children aged between 29 and 35 years old. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane. 

She owns a clinic that has been providing treatment and counseling to the local people, including students from the local schools. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is lack of enough funds to boost business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a grade cow since she wants to diversify her business by doing dairy farming. In the future, she hopes to put up a large dairy farm from which she will be supplying milk to the local people. She describes herself as focused, determined and self-motivated.

loans.use: To buy a grade cow

loans.name: Raponsel

texts.en:

Raponsel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Raponsel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

Raponsel is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Raponsel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Eunice  Kobilo

texts.en:
Eunice C. is a 55-year-old mother of seven children aged between 20 and 37. Eunice does small scale farming as her primary business, earning an average income of KES 5,000 per month, which she uses to support her children. Eunice has been farming for the last 10 years and she has been able to educate her children with the income from this business.

For her third loan, Eunice has requested KES 20,000. She intends to use KES 7,000 to buy 2 bags of fertilizer, KES 5,000 for maize seeds and KES 8,000 for labor and other overhead costs. Eunice hopes to expand her business from the profits she earns. Her dream is to enlarge her business and also to expand the scope of her business to dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm necessities

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Vorng H., 54, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1 USD each day and are supported by three children who are working in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Vorng H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Anita is married and has six adult children. 

Anita owns a specialized retail store in which she primarily sells herbal products like Vita Plus in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim M., 36, is a professional tailor, making $1.50 USD each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband, Khun Nisay, pictured here, makes approximately $2 USD every day, making rice wine. Kim M. would like a loan of $600 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mr. Chum S., 59, has been working in the construction sector for years. He goes to work from construction site to construction site around his community, earning $3 per day. He also helps his wife plant crops when he is free from his job. The couple has three children: one is already married and lives separately and the other two are single and live at home. The coming rainy season is good for growing; however, Chum S. doesn't have supplies for his field. He is requesting a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticide, a pump and seeds for planting. Chum S. will use the remaining cash to repair his broken cow stall.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticide, a pump and seeds for planting

loans.name: James Gathii

texts.en:
James has been farming in Naivasha for commercial purposes for the last four years. He is 34 years old, married to Ann Gathii and they have three children.  

James was introduced to KADET LTD and this will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and on time. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting. James hopes to own his own farming equipment in the future and stop renting. This will save him a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings  for planting

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a good housewife and stays at home taking care of their three children. Her husband, pictured here, has been a moto-taxi driver since 1999. On average, he is able to earn about US$5 per day. This couple is also supported by two children who are employed. Since her children spend a lot on transportation, Chan P. would like take out a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for them to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Yoeun T., 46, is a widowed silk weaver who lives with two children in Takeo province. She typically earns US$2 each day and would like to increase her profits. She is also supported by one of her children who works as a garment factory worker. Yoeun T. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en: Hermenia B. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Cogon II, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Hermenia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business selling fish, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Hermenia is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can purchase a fishing boat. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Hermenia aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Monica is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Monica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP for the same purpose. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Monica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino R. is from the town of Talibon. He is 56 years old. Marcelino is married and has three children. To make a living, Marcelino operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years.

Marcelino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Vergenia

The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and purchasing mangoes for sale. Vergenia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Vergenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Joan Cheongetich

texts.en:
Joan has been selling fish in Naivasha town for the last five years. She is 49 years old and married to Michael Ndirangu. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more fish to sell.

Joan operates a food stall on the side. In the future, she plans to expand it so that it can cater to many people.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel V. is from the town of Talibon. He is 26 years old. Nathaniel is married and has three children. To make a living, Nathaniel operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Nathaniel has been engaged in his business for over three years.

Nathaniel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nathaniel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nathaniel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie R. is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Julie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Julie operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as milo (a powder to mix into a drink), vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Julie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard O. is 32 years old and married. His wife is an accounts clerk and they have one child, aged 9 years. His business is located in Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane. 

He has been providing computer services, including repairs, for the last eight years and has managed to give employment to two people. He gives services to offices, schools, hospitals and other institutions. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more computer accessories to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and diversify his business to real estate some day. He describes himself as very hardworking and self-motivated.

loans.use: Computer accessories

loans.name: Bùi

texts.en:
T. Bùi Thị (20213050022) is a 26 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns a furniture business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month. 

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. T. is requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. The loan will be the fourth taken out by T. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Bùi Thị (20213050022) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T. phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Annah Mutile

texts.en:
Annah opened her clothes shop in Naivasha town a year ago, and she finds it profitable.  She is 36 years old, married to Patel Shilovele and they have three children.

She was introduce to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her first loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings with KADET, which she plans to use to buy more clothes to sell.

Annah hopes to grow her clothes shop, selling all types of clothing to her customers who reside in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

To make a living, Norma runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Norma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Adjotoa

texts.fr: adjotoa est une femme de 29 ans qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de condiments pour la cuisine, elle a commencé ce type de commerce en 2004. elle fait son activité dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. sa clientèle se compose pour la plupart de femmes qui viennent acheter des condiments afin de faire la cuisine. elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de piments séchés, 5 paniers de tomates et divers. elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant.
texts.en:
Adjotoa is a 29-year old woman who has an income-generating activity selling cooking condiments. She began this type of business in 2004 and carries it out in the local market at Hedzranawoé. Her customer base is made up mainly of women who come to buy condiments for their cooking. She is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy two bags of dried chili peppers, five baskets of tomatoes and various other items. She is married and mother to one child.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en: Jane has run a food stall in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 30 years old, married to Michael M., and they have four children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy beans, maize and peas in bulk to later sell to her customers who buy in small quantity. Jane also plans to start supplying cereals in the future as this will boost her income.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and peas in bulk

loans.name: Tima Ole

texts.en: Tima, 23 years old, has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last three years. He says the business is profitable as long as one gets the timing right –  that is when to buy and when to sell. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the cash to buy more animals which he will rear and sell in the future. Tima also plans to start planting cereals on his piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Manuela

Manuela G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 49 years old and married. She has eight children and the younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Manuela operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Manuela has been engaged in her business for over 29 years.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Manuela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

Sempeyo has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 28 years old and married to S. Ole Momera. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and she is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the cash to buy more animals, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Sempeyo plans to start selling hides and animal skin in the future.

loans.name: Bùi

texts.en:
L. Bùi Thị (20213050016) is a 41 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - huyện Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three school-aged children. L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. The loan will be the fourth  she has taken out from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

Samuel has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 25 years old and married to Kezia Wairimu. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and on time. He plans to add stock of sugar, rice and flour, which he will buy in bulk then sell later to his clients in small quantities.

Samuel hopes to run a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and rice in bulk to sell

loans.name: Vilma

The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ezekiel Kariuki

texts.en:
Ezekiel has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. He is 48 years old and married to Florence Njoki. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his second loan with KADET LTD. He has no other history with any other microfinance institution (MFI) and he paid his previous loan well and on time. He plans to use this cash as working capital for adding goat meat in his butcher shop, which is in demand in Naivasha town.

Ezekiel hopes to grow his butcher shop in the future and also open up a food stall, which he will run on the side.

loans.use: To buy more goat meat to sell

loans.name: Consolata Wathenya

texts.en:
Consolata has been in livestock farming for three years now. She also operates a retail shop on the side. She is 26 years old and married to Robert Mugwe. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy two calves and also add stock of rice in her retail shop.

Consolata also hope to build rental houses on her piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy  two calves and add stock of rice in her retail shop

loans.name: Dovi Adjovi

texts.fr: dovi est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique et très animé de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle a une ancienneté de 10 ans dans ce commerce. sa clientèle est grande et elle doit très souvent s'approvisionner pour bien les satisfaire. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, le second crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de s'approvisionner avec 5 rouleaux de popeline bleu, 5 rouleaux de popeline blanc, 5 rouleaux de popeline vert et divers.
texts.en:
Dovi is 46 years old, married and mother to one child. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé district, which is a busy neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She has an income-generating activity selling haberdashery products and has ten years experience in this trade. She has a large client base and has to get fresh supplies regularly in order to satisfy her customers. She has already had one loan from WAGES, which she repaid in full. She is requesting a second loan which will allow her to get supplies including five rolls of blue poplin, five rolls of white poplin and five rolls of green.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina B., photographed with one of her kids, is from the town of Talibon. She is 30 years old. Regina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Regina operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. 

Regina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Regina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase a new engine for the fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for a fishing boat

loans.name: Thyaka

texts.en:
Thyaka M. is 46 years old, married and has five children aged between 14 and 25 years old. Her business is located in Nwingi and served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

She has been selling clothes, shawls and bed sheets for a long time. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is hawking (selling on the street by calling out loud) over long distances. However she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shawls, bedsheets and bed covers to expand her business. She hopes to open a boutique in the future. She describes herself as hardworking, cautious, patient and faithful.

loans.use: Shawls, bedsheets, bed covers

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle T. is from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old. Michelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle manages a vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Michelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Michelle from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị X. (20213050010) is a 36 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. X. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đức Lân - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

X. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, X. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs to sell. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND per month from these activities. In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She is now requesting a new loan of 3.360.000 VND which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrower in the Group:

1.  Trần Thị T. (0) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


X. Nguyễn Thị (20213050010) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh .  X. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Đức Lân - nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  X. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.360.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị T. (0) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Marta Zacarias

texts.pt:
Marta Zacarias M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 4 filhos maiores de idade apenas o mais novo é que vai a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, tem um negócio próprio que pratica ha mais de 2 anos. Vende mais frango e peixe congelado, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00 a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa. 

Ja teve empréstimo em outros bancos e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de residentes de seu bairro que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, refrescos, peixe e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo. No futuro pretende desenvolver ainda mais a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Marta Zacarias M. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is a widow and has 4 older children; only the youngest still attends school.  Marta only studied through 6th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and helps support two of her grandchildren who live with them.

She continues to live in Matola and has owned her own business for more than 2 years. For the most part she sells frozen chicken and fish, earning a monthly profit of around 3000 to 4000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some money at home as well.

Marta had taken out loans with other banks but decided to try something different. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy products (chicken, fish, soft drinks and other items) to increase her stock of merchandise. 

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan as indicated and take out new loans later.  In the future she would like to further develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase of products (chicken, fish, soft drinks and other items)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. is 33 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher and they have two children aged 17 and 14. Her business is located at Mwingi in a very busy market and is served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. 

Juliana owns a mobile phone charging business well known by the name 'Biafra Mobile Charging'. Besides the mobile phone charging business, she sells clothes and juice. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that in some seasons, business is slow leading to low sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes and juice to expand her business. 

In future, she hopes to open her own boutique as well as selling phones. She describes herself as patient, responsible, hardworking and jovial.

loans.use: To buy clothes and juice to sell

H. Vũ Thị (20213050019) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
