texts.en:
Ma. Fe J. is from the town of Talibon. She is 37 years old and married to a fisherman. She has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Fe owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Ma. Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yatt

texts.en: Mrs. Yatt T., 33 years old, is a married woman and the mother of one young son. She is a local farmer who has been farming since 2000. As another source of family income, her husband sells icecream to children in and near the local public school in his community. Mrs. Yatt T. will be using the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops, as well as to buy piglets to raise for extra income. (Mrs. Yatt T.’s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for crops and piglets to raise for extra income

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Mrs. Eang L., aged 49, is married with 11 children, five of whom are married and six who are single. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice cultivating machine inside her home. She provides a plowing service to her neighbors. Her husband works with her in the business. Usually Mrs. Eang L. generates around $5 profit a day to meet the needs of her family. For this crop farming season, she needs capital to buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting. This is why she has requested a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for planting

loans.name: Dardalina

texts.en:
Dardalina M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 44 years old, married and has a 21-year-old child. To make a living, she buys assorted fish and seashells from the fishermen and sells them to the market. Dardalina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. She hopes to expand her business.

Dardalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dardalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang T. is a 43-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She is married to Mr. Pearin, aged 40, who works with her in the farming business. This couple raises crops and pigs, and they currently own a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In addition, they use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. 

Mrs. Hang T. has been planning to build a new house for her married child to live in, but she can’t make that possible due to the lack of funds. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to add to her savings in order to construct a new house. Mrs. Hang T. was busy when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To construct a new house

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is a 35-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Chhnang Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow different kinds of crops. Bun S. planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and piglets to raise

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 30 years old and is married with three children 3 to 9 years old. He has no other dependents. He lives in a rented home in Hoima, Uganda, and his family goal is to educate his children.

Jimmy has a textile retail shop and he has been in this business for two years. He started his business from the savings he got from working with the police force. He faces challenges of old stock which can’t be sold and high competition. In future he wishes to change to a hardware business.

Jimmy wants the loan to purchase more women’s and men’s clothing to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's wear to sell in his shop

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 33 years old, married and has four children. She has been a dairy farmer for three years. She also runs a greengrocer store to earn extra income. Veronica hopes to increase milk production so as to improve her standard of living. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a cow.  In 10 years' time, she wants to have a good breed of cows in her farm.  She says that she is a determined lady.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kihumulo Twimukye Womens, Mubende Group

texts.en:
B. Lauben of Kihumulo Twimukye Womens, Mubende, is a mature happily married father of three children who has been running a salon business for 10 years from Mubende alongside other farming activities. Through his efforts, he has been able to maintain his salon earning 370,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. This income has been significant in contributing towards his family's welfare. 

His current setback is the lack of additional capital for purchasing salon materials such as hair cutting machines, shampoo, hair oils and a hairdrier which is basically demanded by female customers and for further investing in his farming projects for better yields. Therefore this loan will help Lauben in restocking his business requirements which will see him earn more sales revenue as he looks at building a permanent family house and educating his children.

loans.use: To buy salon materials and to invest further in his farming projects

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet B. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children). Annet has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. 

Annet works from home and sells to all kinds of people but at retail prices. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda and a jerrycan of local gin. She also generates additional income through food sales. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to put up her own house and to own a fully stocked bar. Annet rents her home; she has access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and a jerrycan of local gin

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng C. has been operating a farming business for years, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is a widowed mother and has eight children: one is married and seven are single. Almost all of her children are no longer in school and they work at different occupations. 

Her children also work in the farm fields frequently alongside her when they are free from their jobs. Besides her farm work, Mrs. Thorng C. has another skill in sewing clothes. She now wants to use this knowledge to earn extra income, but she needs to have material to perform this service. As she lacks money, Mrs. Thorng C. is asking for a loan to buy essential material in order to begin this service.

loans.use: To buy material in order to begin a sewing business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 32-year-old single mother of one. She is a hardworking lady who earns a living from her tailoring business. She works with two employees in her business which is two years old. Mary hopes to expand her business and own several sewing machines in the future. She is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Funga Leso group. She appreciates Faulu Kenya because she has learnt how to save her money. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy fabric, thread, lining and ready-made clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lining and ready-made clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en: Scola is 46 years old, married and has eight children. She is a farmer who grows kales (sukuma wiki) (leafy green vegetables) to earn a living.  She has been in the business for the past 20 years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she had previously managed to buy a piece of land for farming.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. Scola hopes to earm more income so she can open a shop in the future. She sees herself diversifying into dairy farming in 10 years' time.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bokk Jomm Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BOKK JOMM a été créé depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite en 1995. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et partage le même centre d'intérêt qui la promotion de leurs activité commerciales. 

Madame Hélène N. debout derrière à gauche de la photo et soulevant la main droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est veuve et âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mère de 9 enfants mais qui sont tous majeurs. Par contre elle a la responsabilité de ses deux petites filles.

Elle fait du commerce avec la vente de couscous préparé à base de mil. Elle vend également de la farine de mil et de la pâte d'arachide. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant trois sacs  mil et deux seaux de pâte d'arachide pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.

Son objectif est d'aider ses enfants dans la prise en charge alimentaire de la famille et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jomm has been created in 1995 following the opening of Banc Villageois of Wango to which it belongs. The group is composed of 12 women all living in the same neighborhood and sharing the goal of developing their businesses. Mrs. Hélène Ndion, standing on the left in the back row on the photo, raising her right hand, is the group’s leader. She is a widow, 65 years of age. She is the mother of nine, but her children are all grown now. However, she has two granddaughters in her care. Her line of business is selling a couscous-type dish cooked with millet. She also sells millet flour and peanut paste. With her new loan she is going to boost her stock and purchase three bags of millet and two buckets of peanut paste in order to better meet her customers’ needs and increase her profit margins. Her goal is to help her children pay for groceries as well as to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing millet and peanut paste

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus is 40 years old, married with three children. For 18 years, he has been repairing vehicles. He also does dairy farming to supplement his family’s income. He hopes to own a garage in the future. He belongs to the Mwangaza group in Faulu Kenya and he has become more visionary since he joined the group. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes through the group. With the loan, he will buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in college and the rest are in primary school. For a living, she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been running the business for four years. Currently, she runs her business from a small kibanda (a semi-permanent stall) but she hopes to have permanent business premises and start selling fruits and vegetables wholesale. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to increase her stock of oranges, tomatoes and bananas. This is her first loan from Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To buy oranges, tomatoes and bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, maize, etc. to restock the business

loans.name: Sincere Business Group

texts.en:
Urias D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sincere Business.  He is 23 years old, single, and is currently in school.
 
For four years, he has been selling shoes and slippers on Randall Street in down town Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more shoes and slippers. 

He describes himself as a determine man whose goals are to improve his business, and continue with his education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Boakai is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a business-lady who sells cereals.   She has been engaged in the business for eight years.  She has managed to employ one person.  Elizabeth hopes to expand her business with the profit from her business.  She has really benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has developed a saving culture.  

She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables.   Elizabeth sees herself owning several stalls for her business in the future.  (photo taken at a friend's business)

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, red oil, pepper, salt, soap and seasoning

loans.name: Zainah

texts.en:
Zainah N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Zainah has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for ten years and she works 7 days out of every week. Zainah works at the market and sells to all categories of people but at retail.  

Zainah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through selling second hand clothes.

The main business challenge(s) for Zainah include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are buying another plot of land and to build rental rooms. Zainah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 40-year-old married lady.  She sells duvets, bed sheets and fabric to earn a living.  She has been running the business for eight years.  She also works as a driver to earn extra income.  Penina hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future.  

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 20, 000 Kes to buy more stock of duvets, bed sheets and fabric from Zanzibar.  She would like to expand her shop into wholesale.

loans.use: To to buy more stock of duvets, bed sheets and fabric from Zanzibar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy B.  lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child, who is not in school.  Teddy has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products from home, by means of retail. Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through running a hotel (restaurant).

The main business challenge(s) for Teddy include the high price of charcoal, and lack of customers.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand the business and gain more customers. Teddy lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and cassava

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn E. is from the town of Talibon. She is 31 years old. Charlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charlyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Charlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Charlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, tea, sugar, egg, bread and butter

loans.name: Dismark

texts.en:
Dismark is a married man with two children aged 7 and 2. He owns and runs a greengrocer shop. Besides this, he is employed.

In his greengrocer shop, Dismark mainly sells vegetables. He has one employee. His business is located in a slum and therefore most of his customers are low-income earners. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy more vegetables to sell. He hopes to be a vegetable supplier in five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Aisha has a business selling roasted food like potatoes, cassava, and maize. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works seven days a week. She sells her products at the market, retail, and her main business challenge is transportation.

Aisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize, bananas and cassava. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize, bananas and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell at a profit

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a gentle man, aged 50 years, and is married with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. As for Fred's family dream, he says he wants his children to study and have their own stable incomes in the future.

Fred is a cattle farmer dealing in rearing, buying and selling cattle for a profit. He wants a loan to buy more cattle for reselling at a profit.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for reselling at a profit

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Sarah neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, four of whom are in school. Sarah has a business selling local brew and gin.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.

Sarah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of local gin.  The main business challenge for Sarah is the transportation of jerry cans of local gin from Kyenjojo and Kasese districts.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.

Sarah lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Good Hands Group

texts.en:
Sarah F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Hands.  She is 29 years old, single, and has four children who are between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 12 years she has been selling oil and fish in the “Old Road” Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of cooking oil. 

She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of cooking oil

loans.name: Kabingo Tweyombekye Women's, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
K. Oliver is a hard working business lady. The 38 year old married mother of 5 children, some of them still attending school, sweats her guts out selling agricultural produce of maize, millet, beans, and coffee in a small rural area of Rubumba, Rukungiri. She has been doing this business for the last 6 years.  She started with little capital but with inspiration from her mother-in-law.  She gets many customers who buy her products for food consumption like hotel owners.

She is able to make an average profit of 160,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards, and she requires a loan that will help her buy more food supplies for the business. Then she will be able to meet the customers' demands and also get more revenue.

She belongs to Kabingo Tweyombekye Women’s group of members and they insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase more stock for busines
